description:
The grilled chicken is fantastic! I don't know what they do to the chicken skin! It is perfectly crispy and seasoned. The meat itself is tender and juicy. Finger lickin' good!

I had half the chicken for lunch along with the caprese (which in itself was quite good. It wasn't the best caprese I have ever had, but it was good)

Very reasonably priced too! For a restaurant in North Beach, San Francisco!
author: Shailesh P.

description:
I pass by this place a million times but never went inside despite rave reviews because to me chicken is chicken. Boy was I proven wrong, earthlings!

This chicken is tasty because it's grilled yet still has moisture retention all the while the skin has been grilled to a crunchy perfection. The flavor itself wasn't anything special, literally it just tastes like white meat chicken with maybe some Italian seasoning but the execution of it was perfect.

I haven't tried anything else here except the BBQ sauce which was average. I actually only got take out here so haven't experienced the actually waiting on portion but I can tell you when I arrived the girls working there weren't super friendly. They literally pointed for me to sit down while I wait for my to-go bag and that was it. Not super personable or anything and they were mumbling when I asked when my food would be ready. The customer service could use some improvement and it doesn't matter if it's dine in or take out in my opinion.
author: Connie M.

description:
This place used to be good before it become mainstream 
The servers (Adele) from Romania 
Chenzia the Italian 
Are way to bad when it comes to ho to handle your customers 
Just very tight leggings showing what they got to get more tips 
Another think if you're not a blond haired white dude expect the service to be down 
Chenzia was on break lol as soon as she saw the money at the table she cane over all the way to the table asking me if I need my change while my bill was 28 $ and there was 40 $ on the table 
She was like do you need your change !!!!
Lol all they see is the money 
I use to love this place 
But won't be back till they fix the greed on those girls  and now harassments are started just discovered some private messages from those girls
author: Farid F.

description:
I have passed this place for many years and never stopped for a meal.  Based on Michael Bauer's article in the Chronicle earlier this year, we decided to stop in while at the North Beach Festival.  What a great find!  We ordered: 
-  Soup of the day - it was OK but have had better elsewhere
-  Small salad (which was not small but a good portion to split)  The lettuce was fresh and it had cucumbers and tomatoes.
-  We split the 1/2 chicken with a side of fries (the special comes with one side).  This was the star of the meal.....the chicken was so flavorful and moist.  Hubby and I typically don't finish 1/2 chicken but this was so great tasting that we licked the bones!  $16.50
-   We ordered a bottle of white wine which was maybe $22 and went well with our chicken on  a nice Saturday afternoon.

The place is very small - about 25 or so seats.  Our server was so polite and very efficient.   I saw large plates of chicken piled up at the next table - you can just order a whole chicken without sides too.  If you  in a want delicious chicken in a casual atmosphere and it wont cost you an arm and a leg, try this place that has been around for years in North Beach.
author: Ginger O.

description:
Went here based on a recent article in the SF Chronicle or was it the Examiner??? 

Anyways...the chicken here is FIRE!!! So so well done if you are fan of Chicken. The chicken was around $12 I believe , call ahead if you're in a rush and pick it up to go.  The article noted that they have to re-paint the interior because of the amount of chicken they grill and you can tell as the  sheet rock above the grill is out of commission shall we say. 

Great spot in North beach..you have to check it out.
author: Rod M.

description:
I pass Il Pollaio every day on my commute, and it always had happy people inside, so my boyfriend and I made it a point to stop in. It's not the most spacious inside, but you're not there for ambiance - you're there for the prices and the delicious food.

My boyfriend got half the roast chicken and a caprese salad, and I got the lamb chops and fries. I would skip the caprese, but the roast chicken...soft, flavorful, crisp skin - if you're into chicken, this chicken was pretty amazing. The lamp chops - holy big portions moly. Delicious, but I couldn't finish the portion. The fries were more potato wedge than fries but they came out piping hot.

Their chicken is so reasonably priced that it's hard to justify eating anything else, but I can't wait to try everything on their menu.
author: Christina S.

description: I ordered the half grilled chicken combo with salad, which came out to $18 including tax. My choice in salad was the combination which consisted of beans, radish, tomato, cucumber, lettuce, and your choice of dressing. The grilled chicken was delicious! Seasoned well and tender. Wait til you try the little wing...yassss girrrl... soo flavorful!
author: Mary R.

description: Il Pollaio is my neighborhood roti chicken joint. You can't go wrong with their grilled bird over mesquite accompanied by their wedge cut fries. Decent prices for SF and just as importantly the food is solid. Fresh and made to order I've never had any issues after a dozen plus visits and hope they're able to stand the test of time in North Beach which is no easy task these days.
author: Mitchell M.

description: Buon gigs tutti bene? Love this place   The food is excellent especially for the price   The service is fantastic!! Best service I have ever reviewed  !! These people deserve your business! So many restaurants closing   Please go here! We r vacationers
author: Jane W.

description:
I'm a new fan of Il Pollaio chicken. After ordering their half grilled chicken over a span of a few months, I'm convinced that this is one of the better prepared chickens in San Francisco. I've had a few others that I love, but this is one that I return to time and time again. 

One of the best features of deliciously cooked chicken is the skin. At Il Pollaio, the skin is perfectly blistered on the grill and slightly crisp. The inner part is still moist. So good. 

Prices are fairly cheap. Parking is a pain. Metered only.
author: Ann S.

description: Excellent all around.  Delicious chicken!  Salad combo- order the small salad as it is more than enough.  Get to know Paula and the locals- awesome people!!!!   I'd go again any day.  What a find!!!
author: D M.

description: This place is unbelievable good! The chicken is ridiculously tasty and the ribeye is a second favorite! Staff is always super nice and quick. Such a great and affordable find in North Beach
author: Anjoleen S.

description:
This place may just have the best lamb chops for the money!! 

We ended up here for dinner after venturing out in the city with some friends. It's this tiny place  in North Beach area and it's the very definition of hole in the wall. Tiny restaurant with less than 10 tables, counter and kitchen in the back. 

We were seated right away as soon as we walked in. Our server was friendly and entertained some questions from our party. This was my second visit and I remembered their very yummy and affordable lamb chops. So guess what, I opted for it again! And it was just like the first time! (hmm, that sounds like a song?) Anyways, an order comes with 2 lamb chops and couple of boiled potatoes (traditional side). They have a spicy salsa-ish sauce that goes really well with the lamb flavor. I am picky with my lamb. I tend to shy away from strong gamey flavor of lamb if not done properly however, that was not the case here. It was just perfect!

They also give you a basket of bread with some balsamic, olive oil and parmesan cheese. You can never go wrong with those ingredients!

Il Pollaio holds a special place in my DH's heart. He used to frequent this establishment during his college years and everytime we're in town, we try to always squeeze in a meal from here. 

Definitely recommend this place! Two thumps up for Il Pollaio!!
author: Patricia A.

description: I love this place. It's simple, tasty and is essentially the best Italian comfort food north beach offers. Soup? On point. Sausage? On point! Chicken? Please let's not play. Everything is simple and solid, old school classic but well done and very enjoyable. Viva il pollaio!
author: Stefania P.

description: $25 for a perfectly grilled ribeye! Juicy, flavorful, charred nicely on the outside and very satisfying. Very nice staff! Half rabbit was not gamey, tasted like pork to me. We will come back once in a while!
author: DANIEL T.

description: What an outstanding find. We visited here for an early dinner in early 12/2017. It's unassuming from the outside, and the dining space is on the small side. However, the service was great, and the food outstanding and very reasonably priced. We ordered the half chicken and large combination salad. Bread was included, and what more could one need? The salad was huge and fresh, with Italian dressing on the side. The chicken was moist, perfectly seasoned, and delicious. A simple meal done really well. Would go back if we visit the SF bay area again.
author: F S.

description: Get the half chicken with fries or a salad!! Amazing  The service is great as well. I would defiantly recommend this place. I go there at least once a week and never get tired of it.
author: Anas R.

description:
The best Italian chicken in San Francisco. Easy and simple, cheap and good. If you like rabbit they have it too, almost everyday. 
My favorite is the half chicken, potatoes, and red wine.
author: Florentin H.

description:
Delicious food. Simple menu - one of those places that do what they do best: grilled chicken. Hole in the wall, great bang for your buck. Highly recommend!

Their steamed potatoes are delicious as well.
author: Sue C.

description: Best rostisserie style chicken in sf. The flavors go deep in the meat which does not happen in most of the places. The outer crunch is perfect.
author: Ash M.

description:
I've been eating mostly vegetarian lately, but then I was out with my roommate and had the chicken here... Let's just say I left with a mild obsession.
I just now just had it for the second time. And honestly, I'm not huge on superlatives, this might be some of the best chicken I've ever had.

It's like the juiciest chicken you can imagine, perfectly charred on the edges, served with slices of lemon to spray on which makes it all fresh. I love it.

Other than that the concept is pretty simple, they do chicken well, the place itself is kinda meh, and their sides aren't too exciting; fries were pretty average, tomato and onion salad was good but for $7.50 I'd expect more than like half a tomato, and coleslaw on the other hand was huge but a bit on the heavy side for my taste.

I haven't even had any other of the dishes because I feel like it doesn't really matter. 
It's like I've always been saying: "When in Rome, get the chicken".
author: Mattis E.

description: Cute place. We got the half chicken, pan seared zucchini, and the half rabbit. Half chicken is bomb. The skin is so crispy and delicious, and the drumstick especially is so tender and juicy. Zucchinis were also ridiculously juicy and pretty yummy. There was a misunderstanding with the waiter and we didn't get our rabbit order in, but when we asked they were very kind and they gave us a complimentary marinated eggplant appetizer as compensation. Which was delicious by the way, nice and garlicky and vinegary. Rabbit was interesting, some parts were really gamey, other parts were almost like normal domesticated meat. I don't think I can say I was a fan of the gamey parts, but I really enjoyed the less gamey parts. The steamed potatoes were also very delicious, soft and mildly flavored which really complements the rabbit. I think this is a nice place, I'd come back if I were back in the area
author: Michelle Z.

description: Just get here and order the chicken, you can thank me later. Best grilled chicken I've ever had. It's not fancy, the wine wasn't great, but this is the best $18 you'll spend all week. I ate a half bird ($11) but honestly I could have done a full one it was so good. Follow this up with a house cappuccino from Tosca down the street and you have a winning night right there.
author: Smiley S.

description: This review will be quick " they know how to cook chicken ( again Latin style) it's El pollo loco on steroids
author: Sean K.

description: What this place does really well is crispy chicken skin. That requires technique. Take it home. After 2 hours it's still crispy. It's not fried just grilled unlike some much fancier places in SF who finish their "rotisserie" chicken doing that. Love old school places like this. Unpretentious and delicious. May they be around for another 50 years!
author: Joe V.

description: Aw love this place. My lamb chops were perfect. Decent and cheap house wines! Family place. Quick and no frill no pretension. This place is an endangered species in a sea of pretension and tackiness.
author: Xiu L.

description: Maybe we didn't order chicken so we found the food to be average. The staff was friendly and the place is in a good location.
author: Yoshikage K.

description: The smell of this spot was intoxicating and it was a full house when we arrived late on a weekday night.  My chicken (namesake of the restaurant) had a nice outside, but it was dry - ick.  The bf got the pork chop and it came with this delicious sauce - he won in the ordering competition that night.  With so many restaurants in the area and a better pork chop not too far at don pisto's, we probably won't be back.
author: starrynight c.

description: I have been coming here since the early 90s the only thing that has changed is the price..quality is the same excellent and I haven't seen the owner but a great place.
author: Cindy S.

description: Great customer service and chicken was juicy and tender with nice crispy skin. However, not much of any special flavor/marinade, taste just like grilled chicken unlike el pollo loco where it has a good lemon marinade flavor. Chicken has black charred parts too which can't be good for health. Maybe they should clean the grill more to avoid the black char. Overall not bad, will come back to try the rib eye and pork chop.
author: Judy T.

description: The char-broiled chicken is absolutely delicious here. Add the roasted peppers and delightful tomato onion salad and you have a perfect meal. I'm traveling in San Francisco and wanted a home style simple meal and this was a great fit. It's like you are dining in someone's home--very gracious server.
author: Susie K.

description: Great hidden gem in north beach if you want something other than Italian. Their chicken is grilled to perfection and reasonably priced. I've had the sausages as well which were also on point. Seating area is on the smaller side but I never have issues when I want to eat in.
author: John R.

description:
This place is a little hole in the wall in North beach with some of the best grilled chicken in the city. Very affordable and they have a hand full of other things on the menu that are amazing as well. 
I'm a fan of the combination salad & French fires 
Great lunch specials
author: John M.

description:
So far I have been here twice and it gets better every time. 

The food is great and the price is better. 

I always get the full chicken for $16.50 and a side of the boiled potatoes. Come to less than $25 and I get to keep the other half of the chicken to take home and eat for probably 2 more meals. 

I like it because all they do is season it with salt and pepper and some olive oil then grill it. 

Great deal for take out too!!
author: Michael P.

description: This place is really awesome if you like that delicious charbroiled taste the chicken is fantastic and they give you an option if you want to order a half of chicken or whole I also had a combination salad which tasted so fresh if you want to eat something healthy in the North Beach This is definitely a great spot
author: Robert S.

description:
Fan.freakin.tastic chicken! 

We were so happy with our lunch here. The service was outstanding- attentive and friendly without hovering - and the food really hit the spot. 

The meal comes with bread service that is really yummy, crisp crusted with chewy inside, authentic Italian style and served with cold butter. 

We each had a lunch special: one with a half-chicken and one with 3 sausages.  They both come with your choice of a couple types of salad. We went for the green salad and it was just right - a good sized portion with thick wedges of tomato, cucumber and radish. Ranch dressing was yummy. 

The half chicken was AMAZING - between the char and the seasoning the flavor was outstanding. It may have been the best chicken I've ever had. 

The sausage was good, not spectacular but solidly good. That, and the prices being just a little bit high are the only thing keeping it from being a 5-star review. 

We would definitely go back!
author: Angela Z.

description:
The chicken at Il Pllaio is pretty absurdly good. And when you're in the mood for good roasted chicken, it seriously hits the sweet spot. It's really a place to get down to the basics. The menu is short and to the point. Half or whole birds, salads (I hear the combo is good), some other meat mains, spicy sausage, and sides that include tasty looking steamed potatoes and other carbolicious things. 

I came here expressly for the chicken, and the chicken I got. A whole bird, "small' salad (which is actually pretty big) and a small San Pellegrino all added up to about $25. For one person, it was a large meal. I was damn hungry though, so it was juuuuust perfect. I can see how a couple could split a whole bird (birds run on the smaller side), a larger salad, and maybe soup, and have a plenty filling meal. They also bring bread with the grub. For this price, in North Beach (or anywhere in the city) you can't get that kind of deal. 

I'm totally a fan. This style of food is right up my alley. And you can tell the place is bustling with regulars. Locals. 

Legit.
author: Don B.

description: A small hole in the wall restaurant in North Beach specializing in rotisserie chicken. This is honestly one of the best bang for your buck restaurants that you are going to find in the area. I got a huge plate of chicken and a sizable salad for 15 bucks, which is unheard of in the city. Just a heads up to get the salad dressing on the side, otherwise they will really loaf it up and dump it on hard! With that being said, I am definitely coming back!
author: Ross S.

description: Let me just start by saying, DELICIOUS JUICY CHICKEN. This place really hits the spot! I usually come in with a table of 4 and we order a whole chicken, already cut into pieces. Boiled potatoes over parsley and olive oil. Grilled onions, and the combo salad with Spicy/mild sausages. The spicy salsa is really good on top of the chicken. The food is just amazing and delish! Recommend if you are a group.
author: Liset O.

description: If you are in North Beach in San Francisco you owe it to yourself to try Il Pollaio on Columbus. Their specialty is chicken which is marinated for three days and cooked on the grill Argentinian style to perfection. Their menu has just a handful of items but all are excellent. The Italian sausages are also a favorite of mine. Get their mixed salad and/or the hand-cut fresh fries. Everything is fresh including their bread. This place has been around for over 35 years and that in itself is a testament of their success. And everyone that works there is just so nice and welcoming!
author: Sergio S.

description: Love this place. The menu is simple, the food is always delicious and the staff are wonderful.
author: Kelsey M.

description:
Ah come on man, 4.5 stars? Really? 

I have been living in this area for several years now and have been to Il Pollaio multiple times. However, I only go there when I am lazy to cook at home and want to have food for a reasonable price. I never went there by being excited about it. 

I wish it was the kind of place where they give you this amazing Peruvian chicken but unfortunately, no. Not sure about tourist opinions, but the food is only mediocre for San Francisco standards.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
One of these days you will be in North Beach looking for a solid meal at a solid price.  A meal where you aren't just loading carbs.  That is the time to think of Il Pollaio.  The service is warm and caring.  And the food isn't cheap; it's inexpensive.  There's a huge difference. 

This past Saturday I got a half chicken ($10, can you believe it?).  When you order a main here they give you a break on soup ($5 for a bowl) and salad ($5 for your choice of salad).  Do the math.  I got out for twenty seven dollars including tax and tip.  

Here's the rundown on the food:

A bowl of split pea soup was what you want in a vegetable soup: It was thick and I could taste the peas.  The soup wasn't loaded with salt; just peas.

I got the mixed salad with blue cheese dressing.  It was composed of fresh greens, tasty tomatoes, mixed beans, and cole slaw.  It was large, varied, and good.

The half chicken came last.  They charcoal grill the bird here and they do it well.  Seasoning is subtle but right on.  This is where you get loaded up on protein.

The butter is sweet, the bread is fresh, and they bring it without your having to ask.

As I walked down to City Lights Bookstore I felt like a king with a few extra bucks in his pocket.
author: David D.

description:
Great food and great service. The chicken is deliciously moist and tender, and they don't go overboard on the spices. It's simple and amazing. Also, the pork chops they served were very tasty - it's hard to get pork just right without drying it out, but they do a good job here. 

Overall, definitely worth a try
author: Derrick W.

description: When I said I wish I could eat this chicken everyday the waitress said they're open everyday except Sunday, but I could get extra to go. I love this city!
author: Hope M.

description: From its outside look it doesn't feel like this is going to be great, but the food really is.  We almost went the day before, but we decided to go for seafood instead. When we passed by the front door, while deciding between chicken and seafood a customer leaving the place told us we should really try it out. So we did the next day. We got a whole chicken with great flavor (if you are used to the size of the rotisserie chicken at Costco this will feel a little on the small side). We also had salad with Caesar dressing and an order of French fries.  All good.  Cannot go wrong with that
author: Jc M.

description:
Totally worth it. 
I had half a chicken with fries to go. The chicken was tender and delicious. The fries were also above average. The staff was really friendly and the service was quick.
author: Itamar S.

description: This place is kind of overrated...chicken is alright, the sausages were eh, the fries were good, the combo was was ok. It's kind of just mediocre...it didn't wow me like I thought it would...
author: Kylie L.

description: If you're looking for chicken, this is your place. They  make their chicken in South American fashion, full chickens split open and grilled flat with seasoning that makes even their chicken bones soft enough to be eaten! Not much for environment, but that rawness actually adds to its unique charm.
author: Naomi A.

description:
WOW!!! This place was amazing!  My wife and I got off the Ferry boat at pier 39 and we just couldn't agree on any reasonably priced food. It was way too expensive. I didn't want to buy into that mediocre food of tourism.  So we decided to walk around and ended up at il Pollaio! They greeted us as we walked in and had a table ready as if we had reservations. Even though the place was packed from the moment we walked in to the moment we left.  The waitress was super courteous and tentative to us. 

So! You must eat here before you leave San Francisco! Trust me you can see all my other posts, and I never give out 5 starts to any one!
author: Jose N.

description: Delicious chicken and fries lunch! My husband enjoyed the Italian sausage and fries lunch. We gotour food to go and had a lovely picnic in the park. The food was fresh, service quick, and the prices were more than fair. We will be back the next time we visit SF.
author: Michelle M.

description: I love this place. I've been going to it for the past couple of years since being in San Francisco and I enjoy it.
author: Joe B.

description: This spot is bomb diggity the chicken and potatoes is bomb diggity and can't wait to come back.
author: Haas M.

description: It's all about the chicken! Skip pretty much everything else, except maybe the combo salad which is a pretty good accompaniment for the chicken. But it's aaaaallllll about that chicken! It's fantastic.
author: Erin M.

description:
Il Pollaio serves simple, home style fare the same way they have since the beginning of time. This place is like your favorite pair of old jeans, You wouldn't wear them to the club, but come Sunday you wouldn't dream of anything else. Why change a good thing?

THE VIBE:

Greasy spoon meets Cheers. Regulars coming in for weekly take out box, people joking with the servers. Not a upset person in the place. The decor on the walls is probably as old as the diners themselves, but it's comforting, not tired. Like hanging in your grandpa's basement.

THE FOOD:

No frill comfort food. We split a half chicken, caprese salad, minestrone soup and fries. The soup, fries and chicken were all standouts. These are the things I want to eat when I'm sick, lazy, or bored of everything else. I know they're going to be delicious, consistent, and approachable. Only complaint was the slabs of beefsteak tomato on the salad. Great tomatoes aren't hard to come by, and it would have been a world of difference.
author: Patrick T.

description:
The very intoxicating scent of roasted chicken hits you as soon as you walk in.  Drool.  

The chicken here is the house specialty.  It is absolutely tasty & succulent.  Tender & juicy on the inside.  Appropriately crisp on the outside.  Either a half or whole roasted chicken w salad equals a simple & perfect meal.

I'm a skinny fry girl, but their steak fries rock.

The burger also rocks.  

There's rabbit & steak too.  And the prices?  11 bucks gets you a whole chicken, & a half is only 6 bucks & change.  So reasonable!  Refreshing, right?

It's a small family run business.  It gets crowded.  No reservations.  Patience!  Service is really friendly & efficient.  They've got this whole quick service family restaurant thing down.  And there's always the option of ordering for take-out. 

It's no frills, which is what you want sometimes...am I right?

A north beach mainstay for decades.  Never disappoints.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
- Atmosphere was clean, not too loud
- Chicken is pretty good, not the best I've ever had 
- Onions were excellent
- service was mediocre and rather slow

Overall not a terrible choice but there are a lot of better options in SF... I wouldn't go back.
author: Greg S.

description:
Roasted chicken as it should be done! No razzle dazzle, no heavy sauces to cover the imperfections, nothing! You have a few sides to choose from with the half-chicken special. If you are hungry, the steamed potatoes are very good, otherwise go with the salad. The soups are good too. I really like their minestrone and lentil soups, but the others ones I have tried aren't bad either. They sell Peroni if you like Italian beer, but they have a few other brands too. Their wine selection is small, but not bad at all.

The burgers are good and they make good fries, so it is not only all about chicken.  I have tried their pork and lamb chops too; all good. 

The staff is nice and friendly, and they only get friendlier as they get to know you over time.

For dessert, flan every time! 

One of the best deals still left in North Beach!
author: Afshin A.

description:
This place is pretty awesome.  I had often seen it from the bus, and finally had an opportunity to eat there when my sister came to visit.  Their signature roast chicken is really good and the price sure is right.  The wine wasn't very good, but it was a $20 bottle of wine in a legitimate restaurant.  So, if you look at it that way, maybe it was the best $20 bottle of wine in San Francisco!  

If the name was easier to pronounce and remember, I would recommend it to more people.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Super crispy chicken skin and juicy chicken inside. Hard to beat although sometimes the white meat is overcooked.
author: Abby P.

description: My favorite grill chicken  ordered a whole chicken for and a bowl of pea soup enough for two and left over for tmr, will be back again!!!
author: Xaviere K.

description:
Perhaps the food quality goes up and down based on the day but on a Wednesday at 6PM the chicken was dry.  The cook cutting it up to serve it should know and see this but yet served it.  The frozen fries are not bad but they are frozen not fresh.  A friend of mine in the hood raved about this place so after a couple years of resisting I've tried it out.  

The price $15 isn't bad for SF.  However the fact that they specialize in chicken and the chicken is drier then the Sahara tells me they've forgotten their roots. 

Perhaps the higher stars are deserved.  Places have good and bad nights but in the case off my disaster it was a dinner rush hour night serving perhaps lunch leftovers.
author: Marc Lee R.

description: You just can't escape the aromas! We turned around to go back, following our nose! Boiled potatoes A MUST HAVE! Rib eye excellent! Thin but cooked perfectly!
author: Julia W.

description:
First of all the prices here are just amazing! you get super full for a low bill. 

The chicken is good, not great but good. It's well cooked, but I just wish it was better seasoned. It kinda taste blend. Their boiled potatoes with parsley and olive oil is delicious! Their hot sauce is great! really tasty. 

Not the greatest grilled chicken but a good one nonetheless.
author: Tamara S.

description:
Our first day in San Francisco and we were invited here by our hosts for lunch. I  noticed they had rabbit on the menu and suggested this to my friends as an an interesting alternative to the usual meat and poultry dishes. The cooked rabbit was delicious, but a little tough to cut.Otherwise, very tasty. 

The restaurant is situated on the border between Little Italy and China Town in San Francisco.
author: Neil H.

description:
Il Pollaio is a North Beach institution, and unlike many of the other restaurants in the area, they have tons of regular local customers, like myself. The chicken is obviously the primary attraction. It's always super tasty, with a nice crisp skin, and pairs very well with the combination salad. 

Usually, I just get a half chicken with a combo salad, but when I'm really hungry, I'll also get the Italian Sausages and Fries on the side. Delicious!
author: Allen T.

description: No doubt best kept SFO secret for folks who like to dine solo; we've all had one of those days. Roasted 1/2 chicken, salad/vege, side of steak fries. Sleep easy my friend.
author: Adam C.

description:
I've been having a hankering for roast chicken since I started moving down the path of a plant-based diet. Oh, I still eat chicken in a salad, but it's usually cold and in chunks, not recognizable as a hefty, succulent bird with thighs, legs and a breast. I was starting to feel like Henery Hawk, the tiny, brown chicken hawk with the Hoboken accent, who fantasized about capturing and eating a chicken in those old Bugs Bunny cartoons. Jamie W. and I passed by Il Pollaio when we were strolling through North Beach, and I put it in my memory bank to return when we were feeling slightly more calorific on a Saturday.

Sure enough, that feeling came over us this past Saturday just as the North Beach Festival was winding down, and the beer guzzlers wearing their wife-beaters were having trouble staying erect for their top-heavy girlfriends. We managed to work our way through the still-crowded area to find a tiny table for two just waiting for us in the middle of a very compact eatery on Columbus. The menu is straightforward, nothing fancy, just the kind of food you would expect at an "All You Can Eat" cafeteria line. I was immediately drawn to the Daily Special section where lo and behold, there is a $12.25 Half Chicken with Salad option.

Even though Jamie almost ordered the fries, he decided to be brave and keep with the salad. Good boy. But first, I thought it would be nice to have the $6 side of Marinated Eggplant as an appetizer, and it was. I was actually surprised they sliced a Chinese eggplant, but it was just plain tasty saturated with extra virgin olive oil (see photo). Then came the salads. We wisely ordered the Combination which was an embarrassment of peasant-style riches - a mixed salad with radishes, cucumbers and tomatoes; a cole slaw made of red cabbage; and a two-bean mix of garbanzos and kidneys.

It was all lightly doused with an honest-to-God "Italian" dressing of oil, vinegar and seasoning (see photo). Loved it. But clearly we were waiting for the crescendo of the meal, the grilled chicken, and it didn't disappoint. Nicely charred with the skin nice and crispy (see photo). The breast meat was unbelievably moist, and I still dipped it into the residue of the dressing in the salad plate. Probably because I hadn't had a chicken leg or wing in over three months, I just kept gnawing it to a nub. Bottom line is that it was everything I wanted the meal to be and just $12.25. C'mon, that's a deal.

FOOD - 5 stars...truly good frickin' chicken better than the other Good Frickin' Chicken
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...just a fairly nondescript dive on Columbus
SERVICE - 5 stars...she took care of us and never made us feel like she was too busy
TOTAL - 5 stars...nothing like a flexitarian diet to make you appreciate a succulent piece of grilled chicken
author: Ed U.

description: Chicken. If you like chicken, go here. Don't think. Just go and try the chicken. Incredible. I went here a few times last week and just when I wanted to try something else, I ended up ordering the half chicken with a salad. You will not be disappointed.  Quick, consistent, and amazingly delicious food. I will be here at least once, if not then twice a month here. You'll enjoy it.
author: Zack K.

description: Great place to eat, reasonably priced . The service is fast and friendly. I will highly recommend it for lunch or dinner while strolling through North Beach.
author: Miki H.

description: One of my favorite places ever!!! Grew up going here and sad that I don't live in the neighborhood anymore.  If I did I would always be there. Love the chicken! So yummy and fresh. Comes with fries. The burger is also great. Love getting the combo salad.  Definitely a great spot to visit if you are in the washington square park area
author: Michelle J.

description: this place is an institution! they do simple food impeccably. the chicken, potatoes, and marinated eggplant are to die for. service is efficient and friendly. this place is no frill, down home, great cooking.
author: Jane R.

description:
Noise Level; I heard NOTHING while I was having the chicken, so i am Not Sure
Good for Kids  Yes   
Price Range; Price per person: I think it's Cheap for the Great Grilled Chicken!
Bike Parking; i don't know
Attire  Casual    
Good for Groups  Yes    
Good For  Brunch    Lunch    Dinner   
Ambience;  Divey? Yes,   Hipster? they are not welcome here,    Casual? yes,   Touristy? of course!    Trendy? not really.    Intimate? may be,    Romantic? yes,   Classy? yes,    Upscale? no.

I was here with my family, for my birthday dinner.
3 whole chicken for 5 of us.
WE DIDN'T TALK WHILE WE WERE EATING.
Great Grilled Chicken, Great house red wine, Great service.
I love everything about here, especially such a simple Low-Key atmosphere.
I can not believe that my last visit here was 7 years ago.
I should come here more often.
author: Nobu K.

description:
I had a pleasantly average experience here. The chicken was pretty good, but I guess I was expecting better given the rave reviews.  You can't beat the prices though for San Francisco. Under $25 for a half chicken, large salad (but very vanilla), bread and a glass of wine is definitely not a per diem buster.

There was definitely a consistent flow of local takeout customers, so maybe I was missing something.

The service was friendly and quick.

I would consider going back if I was looking for a decent meal and wanted to save my money for drinks.
author: Brian P.

description: Thought the chicken was rather dry. In fairness, I came at a random time (2:30pm) so they probably weren't serving their fresh batch. Or maybe I was expecting more juices and flavor that I normally get from a rotisserie chicken instead of a grilled/charbroil chicken. The steam potatoes again lacked much flavor. Overall not bad but definitely a little disappointed after reading all the rave reviews.
author: Tinou B.

description: What more can you ask for? $10 for a half of amazing roasted chicken with lemon and rosemary? Love this place!! Perfect for a quick and healthy take out meal :)
author: Brittany G.

description: The best Chicken on the west coast...my wife and I drive from Stockton just to eat lunch there!!!!!
author: Mi S.

description: The gem of North Beach! Hands down the best chicken in SF. Great salads, steamed potatoes and grilled onions as sides. All the North Beach locals come here and it has a Cheers like atmosphere. Overall a great experience every time I'm here.
author: Phillip F.

description:
The positive reviews here are well deserved.

The humble chicken, perfectly seasoned and char-grilled.  Moist, flavorful with that delicious charred edges.

Wasn't too hungry but couldn't resist a take out.  Ordered a whole chicken and couple of hot Italian sausage.  Sausage was good too but nothing to rave about.

We expected to eat half and save the rest for later but it was so good that there was nothing to save.

As another review mentioned, the complimentary bread wasn't that great.  Maybe dry it out and repurpose for stuffing or croutons.

For the size of this restaurant, well staffed, friendly and efficient.
author: David P.

description: Tasty grilled meats (including rabbit) in the neighborhood with fresh salad. Always nice to come here to grab a chill, simple dinner with friends.
author: May W.

description: My favorite neighborhood grilled chicken - FAR SUPERIOR to those grocery and big box chicken deals. And the staff are super nice and efficient.
author: Suzanne B.

description: Excellent place for meet lovers! Service was great, the waitress was very friendly and patient and even offered us a second portion of bread. Enjoyed my experience and the food here!
author: Darren C.

description:
In our office, when people ask if we should get chicken, we don't have to say where, because it's automatic we're going to Il Pollaio. Half chicken, throw on some lemons, and a dousing of salsa. Super good. I kind of want it right now.
NOM NOM NOM.
author: Jon C.

description: Split the whole chicken with lemon and boiled potatoes with my boyfriend, it was amazing!
author: Sam J.

description: What a gem! Straight forward, perfectly seasoned grilled meats and vegetables. Don't expect field greens with a perfect vinaigrette; this is not that kind of place. But house made sausage, grilled lamb cops, moist chicken, all grilled to perfection, accompanied by grilled vegetables such as eggplant.
author: Maia S.

description: Roasted chicken, potatoes & caprese salad. Quite a good deal, very tasty.
author: Anna B.

description:
Super casual restaurant on Columbus with freaking delicious chicken. All the sides are solid as well.

The chicken -- for me that is the reason to come here. It is SO good. You walk into the restaurant and they always have 5+ halved chickens on the grill. They are perfectly seasoned and crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. They got it down to a science. I love chicken - I am always tempted to order roast chicken any place I see it - and this is some of the best I have had in SF. 

The sides are good too - my favorite are the grilled onions. Maybe a bit overpriced at $5 but they are really good. 

Randomly the free bread is pretty terrible here so I would just skip it. Save room for the real stuff!
author: Kerry M.

description: The Chicken...it's worth it. Good honest food in North Beach without the overly touristy feel.
author: Jovone W.

description:
They keep it simple, but do it so well! Great, delicious chicken! (definitely add on the lemon!)
We did take out two nights in a row with a side of yummy steak fries!
author: Minh D.

description: Best chicken and service. Great family run restaurant. Welcoming fast fresh and a great price. I know people come for the chicken but the lamb is my personal favorite!
author: lisa R.

description:
In this area, if you want a dinner for 2 out somewhere, you'll be hard pressed to find anything for $30 or under. It is full of touristy Italian places and expensive food. My boyfriend and I ate at Il Pollaio for under $30 AND we both had leftovers for lunch the next day. 

About the actual food: Simple, delicious, and homey. It was exactly what I needed for dinner after getting home from work. We ordered the half chicken & combination salad, and the hot sausage & side of potatoes with olive oil and parsley. 

The chicken was tender, full of flavor and had the perfect amount of char/crispiness on the skin. The sausages were just the right level of spicy. The potatoes were uncomplicated and so satisfying. Even the side salad, which is usually lame, was a good portion and was packed full of yumminess. 

I also saw quite a few people picking up some orders - so if you're bothered by the casual ambience, you can definitely order for pick up. I'll definitely be dining in and ordering out a lot from now on!

I can not emphasize how perfectly simple and amazingly delicious, comforting and satisfying it was. You are not paying for fancy decor or gimmicks. This is a perfect casual, no frills, REAL neighborhood restaurant.
author: Yishian Y.

description: Best take out in North Beach. The half chicken / half salad is well worth $15. If you haven't tried this place you should change that asap. Quick and delicious. Very friendly staff as well!
author: Miles S.

description: This place has amazingly tasty chicken.  My favorite is getting the half chicken and grilled onions.  You cannot go wrong here and healthy options abound here.
author: Leland T.

description:
Chicken is amazing, price is right, service is prompt and the servers are fun to joke around with.

Can get a little smokey but vents quickly. For a great casual old time SF spot, go here!

Favs:
Chicken
Sausage
Steamed potatoes
author: E R.

description: Good food, great prices. Nothing fancy, just simple food well prepared. I had half a roast chicken, a tomato and mozzarella caprese salad and a bottle of San Pellegrino. I don't usually like white meat but this chicken was tender and juicy. The meal came with good bread and butter. I used the bread to soak up the remaining olive oil and balsamic from the caprese salad, yum. I ate it all up and licked my fingers. Oh, and my waitress was really sweet. I'll definitely be back.
author: P S.

description:
OMG, this is the most amazing chicken ever. The meat is so tender and flavorful. The skin is super crispy and oh so juicy. It's amazing that a restaurant can be so good at one item that they can get away with just serving that and still do super well. Definitely get a whole chicken because you'll want more.

We also got the roasted peppers (good), the salad with everything (fresh tasting) and the fries (average). Everything else is just fillers for the chicken. It's all about the chicken here and it's definitely the best in the city!!
author: Alice W.

description: Incredible grilled meats and a wide variety of salads. Menu is simple and perfect.  Go hungry and check the daily specials. It's no frills with great service.
author: Michael S.

description: I had the good fortune to be introduced to Il Pollaio recently by a friend who was picking up take out. One look at and a sniff of the chicken she was getting and I did the same. This is beyond 5-star chicken~~~and picky doesn't begin to describe me, It's the level of goodness that you might travel to another country with this as the burning motivation! Great, tender, moist, flavorful and perfectly charred ~ chicken bliss. I can't wait to go back and try the grilled onions I've read great reviews of! And that soup looks delicious!
author: Barbara S.

description:
This has got to be one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. It's easily overshadowed by more well-known places like Mama's and Tony's Pizza, but if you're looking for more of a home-cooked or comfort-food meal, this place is it.

TIPS
- Order a whole chicken and ASK for their chimichurri sauce.
- Tuesdays only - must get their split-pea soup. It's the best split-pea I've ever had.
- Yes it's worth getting that extra order of fries.
- But their combination salad is a good choice for days where you're feeling healthier :)

Follow these tips and you'll leave with a happy stomach and a happy wallet!
author: Celia G.

description: I think I come here weekly! If I could only eat 7 meals (one for every day of the week) for the rest of my life il Pollaio would be on the list. Fresh, consistent, and healthy. I get the half chicken and mixed salad. Split pea and lentil soup is excellent too. DO IT NOW!
author: Alex M.

description: Plain, straightforward roasted herb chicken. Nice side salads. Great service. Clean. Not touristy. Fairly quiet. Not lots of seating but it's not the type of place you linger for a long time. I hope places like thus get support because your typical tourist may not enjoy this spartan yet charming, relaxing atmosphere. We ordered two half chickens, lentil soup(excellent) , red bean and garbanzo salad, tomato and onion, basil salad. The tomato was hothouse, disappointed about that. Portions were just enough for us. On street parking only so park in a garage for the day and plan on being in town for a while.
author: David M.

description: This is a San Francisco establishment that I hope never goes away.  We have been going here for a long time and their no frills meals are homey and tasty. The chicken or rabbit (to order, so if you don't' have a lot of time order the chicken) are incredibly good.  This last time we shared the chicken and the sausage with combo salads.  Just like I always remembered it.
author: Ed J.

description:
When I was in 5th grade, El Pollo Loco gave me massive food poisoning, and immediately after that, the mere smell or mention of the name made me puke.  Just ask my aunt, who was forced to keep a barf bag in her car for fear of the times we happened to drive past one for the next month.  I spent the next 8 years (literally) hating on EPL.  Luckily, there were no El Pollo Locos near me after I moved to northern California, so it went off my mind.

I'm sorry to say, El Pollo Loco chicken tastes better than the half chicken I had here at Il Pollaio.  This lacked substantial flavor and really just sort of tasted like g rease.  It wasn't very dry like what others are saying, but it wasn't like, OMG MOIST JUICY CHICKEN either.

Expensive for a lunch spot, since it's JUST a chicken and doesn't come with anything else (fries are bland too, fyi).

Small place that IMO has just okay food but isn't worth a stop, given all the other delicious options in North Beach (or even Chinatown).

The good news is that I didn't throw up after eating here.
author: Tori S.

description: By far the best broiled chicken in San Francisco. Super delicious chicken. Good service. Great time
author: Laird Z.

description: Best grilled chicken in town. I work and live blocks away from this place, and if I am ever in the mood for a good grilled chicken, I always end up here :) You really can't go wrong with this place.
author: Karla D.

description: If you like rotisserie chicken that is prepared well and tastes delicious, then go here. The venue is very simple, and I admit, made me skeptical as to how good the food could be but it certainly exceeded expectations. We ordered the whole chicken along with a salad. Both had a homemade taste to them and were very appetizing. The hot sauce is good too. And the servers are friendly too!
author: Gordon Z.

description:
Chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken.  

This place has 5 star, home-cooked-meal-style chicken.  Order a whole chicken and you won't be disappointed!

Il Pollaio isn't a fancy shwancy place; it's just a very casual, cheaply-priced, hole-in-the-wall place that cooks their chicken to perfection.  

Where else can you can an amazing whole chicken for less than $15?  

In addition to the delectable chicken, their french fries are also really good.  This place only loses a star because I think their salads need some work.  

Nonetheless, if you want a fairly quick, casual, delicious place to eat with tender, flavorful chicken, check this place out!  


I'd like to say it one more time....

"Chicken".
author: Juliana K.

description:
Nice take-out and (small, oddly-shaped) eat-in restaurant specializing in chicken. Apparently they sometimes have rabbit too, which I missed. Cooked on a flat-top grill and heavily-spiced with oregano n stuff, the half-chicken was juicy and really tasty. The fries were steak-cut and not that crisp by the time I got em home, but still quite edible. And the coleslaw was really crunchy - you apply the dressing your own self right before eating. It was very nice.

The wait-staff was friendly and you could watch the chef make your chicken. Decor was okay; nothing special. Overall, a fun place for a super-casual chicken dinner. I'ma come back soon and try the rabbit - if it's up to spec I may give this joint another star.
author: Paul M.

description: The french fries alone got me going like a big meal.  I could have left the hamburger in the frig for another day.  I couldn't help but stare at the chicken on the grill like I should have opted for that.  Since some of the raves is about the chicken chicken.
author: BanBan B.

description: I was highly unimpressed. We heard some good things and we decided to check it out. The first two times we went they were closed, but the third time surprised us when they were open. The chicken wasnt that good at all. The potatoes were a fail as well. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Oh and they told us no outside drinks. I never like places like that. Like who r they to tell u what u can drink!
author: Taryne W.

description: I know everyone has had rotisserie chicken before but to eat it this fresh and this well made is how it needs to be tasted.  Extremely simple but incredible satisfying, similar to the chicken in simplicity the steamed potatoes were so good.  Their home made salsa tasted great on the chicken and they give you a side of bread.  Split a whole chicken and steamed potatoes with me and my brother for 25 + tax and tip, money well spent for the meal.
author: James F.

description:
I have been eating at il Pollaio for almost 20 years. 
The grilled chicken is delicious here, and I also enjoy the Rib Eye steak. 
Soups are excellent as well.  
Food is also reasonably priced. 
This is a no frills and no gimmicks place that is under the radar, which is different than all the hyped up places nowadays.  
The restaurant is also popular with locals although it is in heavy tourist area.
author: Marcus A.

description:
Il Pollaio is mainly known for its grilled chicken, so that's what I ordered. I got the half chicken with fries. It was more than enough food for me and tasty. The fries were thick cut, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The chicken had a flavorful seasoning and was very tender. No complaints, priced right and tasted good. I would consider buying a whole chicken to go in the future and using it in salads or other dishes. 

For the full review with pictures, please visit:
http://consumingcolumbus.blogspot.com/2013/03/il-pollaio-is-more-than-ok-aio.html
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Is it legal to marry chicken in California? I think I'm in love. 

I stopped by this place with a couple of buddies while on our way to Bimbo's. 

The place smelled amazing. The scent of fresh lemon was everywhere. 
There was a little bit of a wait for seating but I didn't mind because they had the Giants vs. D-backs game on and Tim Lincecum was pitching. 

By the time we were seated, we still weren't sure on what to order so our waiter suggested we get a whole chicken, a combination salad and fries to share among the three of us. His proposition sounded good so we took his advice. 

While we waited for our orders, our server brought out some bread and butter. Next, the salad came out. I really appreciated that the server asked each of us what kind of dressing we would like so we could have the salad our own way. Halfway through our salad, the chicken was delivered. It looked modest but I knew it would be perfect. 

I could taste the lemon and pepper and chicken. Moist, tender, juicy, succulent chicken. OOOOOoooooooooooooooooh boy. I want to live forever in that moment when I took my first bite. The skin was crispy enough to not be greasy yet it gave way to accommodate various positions in my mouth. 

The fries were just OK. 

The whole meal, including two soft drinks, came out to $32 for the three of us and we were all fully satisfied. 

Il Pollaio chicken, will you be mine?
author: Daisy S.

description: Oh yeah.  I love this little hole in the wall.  Have been going there for years anytime I am in San Francisco.  The menu is small: chicken, rabbit, sausages or steak as well as salad and fries make us the most of it.  But man I have never had a bad meal here and it is cheap to boot.  Tell that inner voice urging you to order the salad to go away and order the fries instead (or as well).  They are always perfectly crispy and soft and hot on the inside.  Can't go wrong with the chicken here either or any anything else on the menu.
author: Curtis H.

description: I went there on Saturday. I've been coming here for 20 years, they have the best Italian bbq! It Continues to be a great place to eat- casual and worth the wait.
author: Dan F.

description:
Yes the chicken is da bomb!  But my must have dish here is the half roast rabbit.  They make it like no where else.  It's not the wine sauce braised kind like you get everywhere else, it's like their chicken but rabbit.  They don't always have the rabbit so be sure to call ahead.  There was this one time I didn't call, drove all the way out from san jose, and left cause they didn't have the rabbit that day.

I also love their fries.  They don't do anything special, but just thick cut the potato and fry it.  

When Jose was still working daily, he use to spot me a special dish here and there.  The most memorable one is a roma tomato dish drizzle with olive oil and spice.  It's not on the menu, but you can request it.

They also have a egg plant dish (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/66khyY7kxNKiW6x7anZj9g?select=2-L5CI-JtvCNi8RDbfFtYQ) which I still haven't figured out how to make yet, but do get this, you won't regret it.

I tried their pork chop and steak at one point when someone else ordered it.  These are really hit or miss as their stable food is the chicken and the rabbit.

Too bad they don't open on sunday cause Jose the owner is catholic and sunday is the sabbath?  Parking can be a pain cause it's in the north beach area.  There are nights where the wait is extremely long due to the small size of the restaurant.  You can call ahead to make a reservation and they will tell you when it's not needed.  Party of 2-4 is perfect, anything more would be difficult to sit.

I have brought people from all over the world to this place when they visit and they all love it!  Though most people would just order the chicken.  

I have come here for my birthday dinner for many years because this is hands down my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Vito L.

description: Felt nothing but happiness after this! The chicken was grilled to perfection, the potatoes tasted amazing, and the lemon added a great flavor to the whole thing. It was my first time trying Argentinean food and I fell in love with it :)
author: Shahad K.

description:
I came during lunch time on a Wednesday. This place is an institution and I know it has a lot of regulars. I witnessed that fact that afternoon. The waitress knew people's names and in general, their orders. She was not unfriendly, but businesslike. I ordered the half chicken and green salad combo with bleu cheese dressing on the side. My boyfriend tried the Italian sausage and ordered a side of fries. 

My salad came out right away and the waitress brought out an extra plate so he and I could share, a nice touch. I don't usually eat salad dressing so the bleu cheese was for my boyfriend and he loved it because it was ultra creamy. Also, the lettuce in the salad was very good. Crispy and very nicely done. The half chicken came out several minutes later (various pieces of chicken: some breast, thy, a drumstick), followed by the Italian sausages. The fries took the longest, which I understand because they were freshly fried, but the fries were so good I wish they came out sooner so we could have enjoyed them with the rest of the meal earlier. 

My chicken was okay. It was seasoned well and the skin was crispy, but I'm sorry to say I prefer the rotisserie chicken from Costco. The chicken wasn't dry from Il Pollaio, but it wasn't very moist either. My boyfriend's spicy Italian sausage was very good, but a bit overly salty, so he couldn't eat very much of it, knowing the salt would get him later. Thankfully sausage is something that reheats well so we were able to take it home. Like I mentioned, the fries were delicious!! Very crispy on the outside and uber fluffy on the inside.

Overall, I don't think I would come here again unless I was in the area, but if I was in the area, I'd likely just get a slice of pizza from Tony's or Goldenboy. But that being said, it really is a pretty good option since this area is typically overpriced and touristy if you're in the mood for chicken.
author: Victoria J.

description: Oh so good! The chicken was tasty and charcoaled. Even loved the bbq sauce. Also - the split pea soup was super yum - thick and smoky. And the combo salad was fresh and simple. Small locals feel to the place. Loved it.
author: Andrew K.

description: Chicken here is consistently good. I ordered using the Caviar website. If you sign up using this link you'll get a $20 credit in your account https://bnc.lt/W9Qc/yH6pJdI0sv . Who doesn't like a free meal!
author: Shivam S.

description:
This is a simple and unpretentious restaurant located in North Beach. The owners are from Argentina. The menu includes: grilled half/whole chicken, grilled half rabbit, steak, pork chop, lamb chop, sausages, side dishes: fries, cole slaw, green salad, etc. When I drop by, I usually order the half chicken or the half rabbit.

- Nice service
- Simple food preparation, nothing fancy
- Affordable prices, 2 people can dine for ~$20
author: Luis C.

description:
Basically, Il Pollaio is the El Pollo Loco of North Beach. They offer chicken, chicken, chicken, and oh...did I mention, chicken? ;) Just kidding, they also have different salads and sides too.

My boyfriend had been here before so he recommended it for our lunchdate. At first I wasn't sure what to order because heck, even a half chicken seemed like a little much, but I finally decided on the chicken breast sandwich. You can order a whole or half chicken so Il Pollaio is great for sharing and going with groups.

After about a 10 minute wait, we were off to the park to enjoy our lunch. I opened the box and saw what appeared to be a sandwich. It was HUGE! Two pieces of grilled chicken breast atop a bread roll. The sandwich also comes with tomato, lettuce, onion and a side of their salsa. Overall, the sandwich was good. The chicken was extremely juicy and flavorful and I loved the salsa BUT it was just TOO MUCH chicken. However, at $12.95 I guess I got my money's worth in chicken but overall it was way too much money for a sandwich and a side of fries.

I would definitely come back to Il Pollaio but next time I will just share a whole/half chicken instead of opting for the sandwich. Much cheaper and sensible option!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Delicious chicken.  Like, so good that I'd like to use expletives to emphasize my point, but have to avoid doing so.  The whole concept for this place is so simple and so well done, particularly for those times you're in the mood to switch off the bougie SF foodie persona and go casual with some food like grandma makes (if my grandma were Italian).

Take out and eat a half chicken at home while catching up on your DVR, or dine in with a bottle of wine and some tasty bread w/ oil and vinegar, and people-watch the tourists through the big windows facing Columbus.
author: Julia W.

description:
I've been coming to Il Pollaio for years. It's a nice little family-owned joint that serves up some pretty tasty food. The chicken is always great off the grill, with a little squeeze of lemon, but I generally go for their burger or their 3 sausages. The burger is good meat and I get it medium rare. It's kind of a longer shape than the typical patty and they usually serve it on a scooped-out piece of baguette or sometimes ciabatta(which I don't like as much). The 3 sausages meal is interesting because I guess you can get it as a sandwich on the baguette, but I've also gotten them uhhh...not as a sandwich. The sandwiches come with hella tomatoes, lettuce and raw onions, but I uusually take out the lettuce and tomatoes and eat that separately as my salad. 

The rabbit I've had a few times and it's great, but a bit too pricey for me to get regularly. Salads are good and filling, but I always get fries on the side of everything. Just a bad habit I guess.

Service is pretty friendly here and unlike some places, once they've seen you coming in a few times, they'll start to remember you. Always a plus to me.

I like this place because it's always remained pretty much exactly the same for the past decade I've been coming here. Go by yourself, watch some soccer, drink a Peroni and sometimes you can have some interesting conversations with some cool people around. A great place to just hang out, eat and people watch. As far as atmosphere, I greatly prefer it to the other restaurants on that strip. It's actually probably the only restaurant on that strip I feel comfortable being in. No douchebags, not too many tourists and no hipsters. It's pretty much a locals kind of joint that serves good, unpretentious food.
author: Miguel G.

description: Small place with a very limited menu. However, they are known for the grilled chicken, which is very delicious. I generally order the half chicken with fries and I am 100% satisfied each time!
author: John D.

description:
Everybody, and I mean everybody - from neighbors to a career coach at work, rave about Il Pollaio but it is really just over-rated.

The only thing I can agree with folks is that it's a cheap meal. But here's where I disagree. Every single time the chicken is dry, dry, dry. Unless that's what you look for in chicken, I think there are many places to get much tastier and moist chickens. The sausage platter didn't impress either. Oh but the salad was good... I guess becuase it didn't meet the grill. 

If you really want chicken on Columbus between Green and Union, then fine... Il Pollaio is an option to consider. Otherwise just recognize that it is an over-hyped eat.
author: Jon L.

description: This restaurant is famous for its chicken and salads. The chicken is pretty nicely done, the combination salad is also a good deal. The service is attentive without being intrusive. They should maybe buy more bottles of oil, we had to share ours with 3 others tables. The price is decent and affordable but I have to admit that I was expecting a price a little bit cheaper.
author: Thibaut L.

description:
Don't go here.  Leave it for the people who know and love San Francisco.  

I mean, here's the deal.  Good food.  Good people.  Low prices.  

Really, go to one of those places with attractive young people speaking in bad Italian accents inviting you to eat mediocre food.  Skip this place.  Or better yet, go eat over priced garlic down the street.  It is where everyone told you to eat, right?

Unless you want the real deal.
author: Polly P.

description:
A lot of people say this place does not make chicken as good as their grandma makes. 

well until your grandma opens up a restaurant in san francisco I will eat here. 

this place is good.
author: Dico B.

description:
WOW!  Just had dinner here.  I'm trying to conquer all of Little Italy this month.  Anyways, I always walk by here and it's always packed.  So for dinner tonight, I just remembered that I haven't been here yet so the lady and I went here for dinner.  

Upon entering the venue, a waiter quickly greeted us and showed us to our seats.  We actually got lucky because we got the last table.  We were then brought bread & butter as well as a couple of waters.  After looking at the menu we then ordered the 3 Italian Sausages with Fries and a half chicken.  Amazing!  The chicken has the white and dark meat and is superbly flame broiled.  Great flavor!  The sausages are amazing as well.  No additional sauces need for this!  Just magnificent on its own.  The fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Super piping hot though, watch out!  Anyways, we asked for ketchup and got ketchup, tabasco and salsa.  What?!?!  Salsa?!!??  The salsa was pretty good and accompanied the chicken.  Very tasty dinner for under $20.

Can you dig it?!
author: Limzer L.

description:
I was trying to soothe a hangover with some comfort food, and had wandered around poking my head into much too full and much too vacant restaurants until I found this restaurant that was juuust right, or so I thought....

I looked at the food on everyone's table and it looked great! I found a seat and was handed a menu, and it was all down hill form there. All the menu says is "Full Chicken" this much, "Half Chicken" this much, "Soup" this much, with no description of what you're really getting. And when I asked the waitress she was polite but very brief and then gone.

So I settled on a Hamburger and fries, greasy and perfect for my needs, and who can mess up a Hamburger? Well they can. I got a DISGUSTING giant flat patty thing on a sub roll. It was about 6 inches long and 3 inches wide, not a burger, with three giant tomato slices (giant watery tomatoes are the giveaway for stingy ingredients) and half flaccid french fries.

My waitress also abandoned me right after service to have a 30 minute conversation with some other customers.

The restaurant obviously hasn't been cleaned in a while, either. There are still some christmas decorations up in the window, and a bag of garlic hung up with a millimeter of dust built up.

Even if my waitress had cared about how my food was, I wouldn't have wanted to change my order because I didn't want a giant plate of just chicken. They need to make plates of meat and side combos for people who like a little variety.

I regret not sending the food back and leaving.
author: Brie P.

description:
What I Ate
- half chicken
- Italian sausage
- roasted peppers

Would I Go Again?
No.  Everyone raves about the chicken, but I thought it was pretty dry.  The Italian sausages were bland, and the roasted peppers were soaked in olive oil.  Maybe the chef was having an off night, but I do not plan on going again and finding out.
author: Ben M.

description:
It was the day before my friend's birthday and she wanted chicken for breakfast so the four girls including my self went here per recommendation and Ohh My God, we felt like queeeens! The chicken was the BEST Succulent, tender, crisp, and heavenly thing EVER. The four of us shared a whole piece of chicken and we even had one piece left over.. I wasn't planning to eat but the hand kept on reaching for more of the juicy meat. 

Although the chicken was amazing, my friend was dissaponted that the bread for appetizers was not warm. We also had the chicken with the fries. It looked good and golden but they were meh..
The steamed potato, which was buttered simple and steamed to where it melts in your mouth but served somehow in tact with the parsley was good!! But I think I can make it at home.
 
The food was served timely and we can see the whole chickens being grilled behind the register of the mom/pop store. Our waiter was foreign so it made it feel like we were really out in europe too. The restaurant is in the middle of little italy which is near by the fishermans warf so it's a perfect spot after or before a stroll around town. 

THE PLACE DOES NOT DISAPPOINT WITH CHICKEN!
author: Iris Y.

description:
Let's get some chicken and rabbit! 

Doesn't look like much from the outside, but OMG delicious and cheap! Half a scrumptious chicken for $8.25, can't wait to go back for more marinated eggplant $5.50, a full carafe of house red wine for $14, and one side salad that could easily be split 3 ways? SOLD!!

Go early, they close at 9pm.
author: Jaime H.

description:
they served bread first with butter
we ordered a whole chicken with Mix salad, Fries and Coke

Pros

-Prices 
-the service was good and fast
-Fries was really hot and crispy
-So many dressing for the salad to choose from ( I chose 1000 Island)

cons

-Chicken was good not fantastic as I expected It was just ok 
-Toilet wasn't' really that clean

If I will be back to this place maybe because of the salad and the fries not the chicken
author: Fatma I.

description:
Petite deli was closed by the time we got to north beach so we stopped by il pollaio instead. Quaint ambiance, kitschy italian decor - autographed pictures and italian ads. Very friendly service. Large open windows great for people-watching (all the tourists that walk through the main strip). Good amount of seating but mostly four-tops so large groups may not be the best. Watch out for parking, as with most of north beach. 

Chicken was soooo good! Flavorful, tasty, tender, moist. He got half chicken with salad, I got chicken sandwich with fries. All of the above is recommended for superb tastyness. 

Would definitely come back for more tasty chicken. $41 for food, a glass of wine, tax and tip.
author: Joyce C.

description: The chicken at this place is to die for. Juicy on the inside, crispy skin on the outside. Coupled with fries, you just can't beat it.
author: Bud H.

description:
This is one of my fav places..  THEY DO CHICKEN PERFECT HERE!!!!

Combination Salad, Half Chicken.                        This Place Does chicken Right!!!!  FIRE!!
author: Sonny S.

description:
This place absolutely brought out the pregnant lady in me.  Can't beat the value for this awesome food.  And apparently Nancy Pelosi agrees.  Went there one night in October, waited outside for like 15 minutes, and a couple of black SUVs pull up, a couple of hardcore security guards stand in front of the door, Pelosi runs in and runs back out with a big to-go bag.  Okay, here's my problem with that.  We have no money for SHIT.  If Pelosi wanted her chicken to go, why couldn't she just send one of those security people on their own in a normal car?  Instead, she had to take the reallllllly efficient route of having TWO cars, drivers and security guards, so she could pick up her food, right?

Okay enough about that.  Food.  I just really liked it b/c for $10/person, got this really simple but delicious three-bean salad with olive oil and a huge 1/2 roasted chicken.  Nicely roasted, juicy.  Can't beat that kinda comfort food with a stick.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Arguably the best chicken you're going to eat in San Francisco. This place is a gem when you're looking for a no nonsense tasty meal in North Beach. 

My usual is:
 - bean salad
 - half chicken
 - enough said.

This is the perfect place to stock up on protein a few hours before a game if you're an athlete. When I eat here before playing football (soccer) I always have more energy during the game. Love this place.
author: Bryan B.

description:
what i ordered... a whole roasted chicken

one awesome bird...... well seasoned and perfectly charred.....tasty by itself without any additional sauce(s).  the bread that came with it, was better off to be thrown away or use it to clean up the drippings around your lips.

ambiance... ok (small and cramped but the area was great)
service... ok
cost... $$ (expensive, birdy was small and costly)
author: Gors P.

description:
I'm on a North Beach restaurant tangent - and this place def rocks the feathers off a Foster Farms chicken. For some reason, I hadn't been craving chicken in awhile, so was quite disappointed with myself for waiting so long to check this place out when I've known people living in North Beach for years. 

Juicy chicken from a rotisserie with option of salad or french fries is fine by me. Zach and I each got a meal, so we could have both fries and salad and it was WAYYY too much food for 2. But priced so well we were down for leftovers :) I can do some amazing chicken salad sandwiches with leftover, roasted chicken.

But I'm dithering - waiter offered to split our salad plate into a combo of bean salad and green salad that was what I call top notch service. 

Definitely a great meal, affordable and will have you doing the stereotypical finger licking chicken action!
author: Alita M.

description:
Seems like the best local places are the last ones we are hitting - don't ask why.  I've read so much about the chicken here and actually tried to come here once on a Friday night only to find a line snaking outside.  We finally made it in on a Thursday night when it wasn't too crowded.  We were seated shortly after we walked in and noticed the place is not as big as we had thought.  There were 2 tables of 2 to the left across the grill and a mix of 12-14 tables of 2-4 that can easily be combined for larger parties.  

We got a table next to the window and studied the one page menu.  We knew we had to try the chicken and when hubby saw lamb chops on the menu, that was it.  While waiting, bread was served warm w/ cubes of butter.  We ordered a carafe of the chablis ($9) to go with our meal:

small combo salad - $5 - a mixture of lettuce, kidney and garbanzo beans, onion, tomato, shredded carrots with vinegar and oil

lamb chop with steamed potatoes w/ olive oil and parsley - $15.95 - you get 4 large pieces of meat cooked to order.  They must cut their own.  Each had a large round bone near the top or center - It's not the best cut but the marinade was very flavorful.  The potatoes were so good - I chowed down every last drop.

1/2 chicken - $7.95 - it was cut into quarter for us in advance.  the crispy skin was delicious but the meat was a bit dry.  we only wished there were more skin on the chicken.

our waiter was very friendly and helpful, he even gave us a free glass of chablis when we finished our carafe.  

It's a great neighborhood joint for a casual dinner.  We already know what we'll be ordering next time - the rabbit and the large golden crispy french fries.
author: Gloria H.

description: Great casual spot for roast chicken. It's pretty down to earth, a good value, and quick. The eggplant dish is also very good (and recommended to go with the bread).
author: Victor W.

description: Good chicken but definitely not the best. The price is more than reasonable and they are quick
author: Eve C.

description:
Problem #1: I am surrounded by sandwich places when it's time for lunch. I decided I want chicken, not chicken chunks in a sub, not chicken slices between 2 pieces of bread and not chicken bits grilled inside a panini. I want to pick the bones out myself and tear off the crispy skin with my teeth. 

Solution #1 = Il Pollaio. 

Problem #2: It is located 15 minutes away from my office. With hills to climb both ways. Steep hills.

Solution #2 = Just enjoy the sandwiches nearby.

It took 15 minutes and 43 seconds before I was at the counter ordering my half chicken for about $9, drenched in sweat and fighting tired legs. When I was presented with this half a chicken who sacrificed half its life to fulfill my hunger, the smell of it was enough to make me forget my tired legs. Then I realized I have to make the trek back to my office before consumption. $#!%

The skin was very crispy while the meat was just right and not too old, it was grilled masterfully. I had won the war against sandwiches that day with the only casualties being my sweat soaked dress shirt and funky body odor for the rest of the day. Well worth it if you asked me, but maybe not for my coworkers eating their sandwiches next to me.
author: Roy H.

description:
El Pollo Loco got nothing on this place. Instead of being another Italian restaurant in this Italian neighborhood, Il Pollaio is alternative option with a delicious menu.

Il Pollaio is discretely located along Columbus street close to Washington Square park in between two restaurants. It's a small place, but you shouldn't let it's size deceive you. I'd say the biggest group you should go here with is 6 and the best time to eat here is around lunch hour. 

The service here is great as the waiter/waitress is quick to seat and take your drink order and kindly assist you of in need of help. 

On to the menu, there many great things to choose from. For starters, their salads are generally delicious and nice apportioned and worth munching on while you wait for your main order. They have your typical beverages from sodas to beers and a small wine menu on the back cover. For the main dishes, the three primary choices I tend to look at are the hamburgers, the smoked sausage, and the chicken. 

Do not underestimate the hamburger, it's massive. They fire grill it and serve it on a piece of roll. The patty is huge and will leave you stuffed or wanting to save it for later. The smoked sausage has looked good although personally I have yet to try it. The most popular and best of all, the chicken. You have a choice of a half chicken or whole chicken that is fire grilled to Perfection. A half order of chicken is suitable for two people with a whole meant for 3-4 people. The price varies with what you order, but the cost is worth food you are getting. In addition, I typically always order the French fries that are cut in steak like fashion and are simply fried to perfection. I forgot to mention, they always bring you some bread to munch on with butter, always something I look forward to when eating from this place.

Today i spent $25.00 on a whole chicken, large fries, one coke and it was well worth it. Next time, the hamburger it is with the sausage the following visit. Il Pollaio is undeniably the pound for pound king of the chicken in North Beach.
author: Jesus A.

description:
No pretense.
