Really good charcol grilled chicken.

Try the marinated eggplant, I don't even like eggplant but LOVED this item.

French fries are thick cut and really good.
author: Mike I.

description:
Meh.

A friend recommended this place, raving about the rotisserie chicken. I found it to be kinda dry and mediocre. Have I been spoiled with my Peruvian rotisserie chicken experiences? Can I no longer enjoy regular rotisserie chicken?

I will say the marinated eggplant was pretty effing tasty. Tangy, garlicky, yum. I was also into the steamed potatoes with olive oil and parsley. In fact, those two dishes eaten together would make me pretty happy. But yeah, the chicken...meh.
author: Karena Q.

description: If you are in the mood for some amazing chicken off the grill Italian style this is the place! Family owned and operated, I have been going here since I was a little kid. Very friendly staff, good chicken, side salad and half an order of fries! Can't beat it.
author: Rachel J.

description:
Ok, first off, this is listed as a Latin American restaurant which it is NOT. WTF, Yelp? (I did not factor this error into my rating)

Second, don't go here if you're looking for anything other than meat, cause that's all they have. Plain meat. My dad and I got the italian sausages and my stepmom got the chicken sandwich. It was good, but nothing remarkable at all. Stepmom wondered why there was so much bread on the chicken sandwich ("It was like they stuck a piece of chicken and some lettuce and tomato inside a loaf of bread!"). Pricey, considering the quality, the atmosphere, and the extremely limited menu. The only thing that really stood out was the marinated eggplant (delicious) and the french fries (piping hot and fried to golden perfection even if obviously from a freezer).

Third, the waitress seemed really crabby. She only had 6 tables but hardly paid any attention to us, seemed really frantic, and when we did request something (like ketchup or a water refill) she seemed hurried and pissed off. We figured she was having a bad day for whatever reason and still tipped her very well (25%), but come on, be more professional and courteous, there's no excuse for such an attitude in a service job in this economy.

If you want meat and potatoes that are nothing more than the italian sausage, chicken, and frozen fries you can get at Safeway, and to pay 5x more for it, in a shabby atmosphere, and served by a waitress that isn't very nice or attentive THIS IS YOUR PLACE!

(I really, really tried to understand why this place has so many five-star reviews. Is it because the places around it are even worse? Who knows, but your money is better spent at dozens of other places in the city that are a much better value.)
author: Ben G.

description:
It's too bad there's already a place called Good Frickin' Chicken in SF...Il Pollaio should grab the title of Great Frickin' Chicken! 

Don't mess around - order some chicken, squeeze some lemon on top and enjoy. Did I mention you can stuff your face for under $20, including a glass of wine?

Cheap and easy, just like Phil H.

ps...they close at 9pm so if you want to get your chicken on, do so early in the evening.
author: phil h.

description: Good grilled chicken, but even better lamb chops!  Carnivore heaven.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Colombian/Argentinian style bbq.

Grilled onions are salty & delicious. Eggplant is so so.

The half chicken is a solid bet..the lamb chops weren't bad either. Tempted to try the rabbit next time. Didn't have the courage to pull the trigger last night.

Felt oddly similar to a korean bbq experience when we were finished.  Perhaps because everything was pretty salty. Remember to drink lots of water after.

Def. worth visiting once.  If you find a comfort zone in the menu then you can make it a regular stop.
author: Salmaun A.

description:
Simply stated: some of the best frickin' chicken I have ever had in my life.

Thats really all I have to say. Their sides are average....nothing special. But you don't go here for the sides...you go for the chicken. The chicken is where it is at.

Juicy...seasoned just right....

Its just strait up good chicken!

The end.
author: Sarah G.

description: Best grilled chicken in the bay area! Great portions, good prices, glass of good red wine for only $6, combination salad is delicious, sausages are yum and very friendly staff! It's just a hidden gem if you haven't come yet and you love chicken, come now! I don't know why but this chicken always reminds me of my summers in portugal! Oh and they do a boiled potato that is just sticky deliciousness with awesome olive oil. The most friendly employees and owners that offer excellent service. I have many fond memories of eating here with my dad. If you can't figure out where to eat and you want good food that won't cost you an arm and a leg, please come here! Bon appetite!
author: Bri S.

description:
It is really sad to see once a great restaurant turns into something else. I'm sure Jose taught these cooks how to cook chicken and other meat as well as he could, but none of these recent cooks came even close. (Freddy was really the closest one.)

I realized one day, so many disappointing chickens later, that I was coming back here week after week thinking that  I can have Jose's dream chicken but it doesn't exist anymore... It got lost long time ago when he retired. 

I am sad.
author: Wakaknee J.

description:
Doing the southbeach or Atkins diet? Need a $10 meal for 2. 
Order to go or visit Il Pollaio. I heard about this place on yelp and most weeks it's a weekly tradition--saved for the day we have to work the latest and spend the least amount of time and money. We always get it to go. Get a freshly grilled chicken, deliciously seasoned with some lemons to squeeze on top and a side salad, it's the perfect quick meal!

The women who run the counter are quite pleasant!
author: Nikki M.

description:
For those of us who do not have access to a kitchen fit for cooking a big old four course meal (or are lazy like me), Il Pollaio is an excellent choice.  We got a whole chicken, which may actually have been one of the best chickens I've ever eaten, a sampling of their appetizers, and a salad.  Of the sampling of appetizers, the pepper dish and the eggplant were great (and served cold, surprisingly).  Coleslaw and salad aren't so fabulous--stick with the stuff they cook, it's old school food.  More than enough for three hungry people.

Next time I'm craving a home cooked meal, this is where I'll come, instead of pretending I'm capable of making a chicken half this delicious/starting a dinner like this at an hour that would actually permit me to eat it before midnight.
author: Sydney H.

description:
Chi... chic... chicken... chi... chic... chicken... That is what you must order when you come to Il Pollaio!!! Everything else pales in comparison to, what's the name - oh yeah... The restaurant says chicken in Italian. So it cracks me up when I see people order rib eyes here. A whole roasted chicken, salad and fries, can feed a big family of 4. Fries are fries, salad is just a salad, but you can wash it down w/ some good cheap sangiovesee or chianti for an extra $16. 

Mama Mia!!! Now that's Italian...
author: Minh V.

description:
Ahhhhhh, Il Pollaio. I have been ordering out from this restaurant every week and a half or so for the last couple months, but today was the first time I ate out here. Atmosphere is comfy-cozy, just how I like it, our server was very sweet, kind, and helpful, and the wait for the food was only about five minutes, which was awesome, because I was STARVING and couldn't have the bread, since I was celebrating Passover. "But what about the food?", you may ask. The food was AWESOME. The chicken is delicious (three friends and I got a whole chicken, large garden salad, and large fries), I had no garden salad, because that kind of salad is not quite to my liking, but my friends said it was great. The fries were lovely looking, and they were so good I felt less guilty about eating them. The only reason that this didn't get five stars is the fact that we had to wait 10-15 minutes for our food to be taken and our check to be given. I was so full, though, the wait just gave me a couple minutes to relax. 

I would highly, highly recommend.
author: Margeaux W.

description:
Bok, bok! What are you, chicken?!

If this place were to be taunted by elementary school children, it would respond, yea, I'm chicken! Damn good chicken!

For someone who is a fry fanatic, given the chance between salad or fries, well, it's a no brainer, but at this place - the combination salad is as good as the fries. *Droool*

The chicken is consistently good and flavorful. I've frequented quite a few times and their prices have gone up. Boo, but I'm sure this is the trend for every place. 

Oh yea, one more thing: don't order the burger here. I did it once. Never again. It was dry and more dry. Bleh.  Chicken is the way to go. 

Bok, bok!
author: Dolores L.

description: Very tasty chicken and salad. Love the food, the place is a little small but charming. I will be back for more and invite my friends too.
author: Glenda P.

description: This is a good place to grab a casual meal, especially if you want a lot of food. I have ordered the chicken, combination salad, fries, and split pea soup at this place. While the volume of food is a good deal for the price, I was not impressed by the food. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, but not something I would come back for. The fries were fresh from the fryer, but were really bland. The split pea soup was unpleasantly thick and had a bitter taste.
author: Julia W.

description:
Many yelpers claim Pollaio to be the best chicken in the city. I was looking forward to having my poultry mind blown. I must have gone to the wrong place.

Things started well with an impressive execution. You go from ordering to a box of chicken in less than five minutes. What's in the box, however, is disappointing. Good? Sure. Didn't have to make it myself? You bet. But for $9 it was expensive and far from the best. Closer to bland. Dry. Underwhelming. Meh.

Safeway chicken is just as good. Grandma's is even better.
author: Jason B.

description: Chicken very dry.  I mean very very dry.  Salad fresh and veggie soup was good.  But the chicken, the main reason for Il Pollaio was dry and bland.
author: Jerome B.

description: I have been coming here for at least 8 years and I always have a good experience with the food and service. The food quality always consistent. You may have to wait a little bit on the weekend if you catch their on their rush time due to their limiting seating space, otherwise everything is alright.
author: Shadi K.

description: Half chicken and combination salad are good.
author: Yejun Y.

description:
Chick-uhn good!

I had hard so so much about this place I just had to finally try it! And ill go ahead and say it, it wasnt mind blowing..but it was damn good and thats what counts!

A half chicken with fries was plenty for my boyfriend and I to eat..and with leftovers! And the chicken was delish. Juicy, crisp skin, well seasoned, Mmm. They also load you up on bread and butter which is awesome.  

My only complaint is the cole slaw. Not quite cole slaw..more like shredded cabbage salad. But hey-this aint KFC.. what was I expecting!
author: Britney K.

description: We have been going to Il Pollaio for years as faithful customers, I'm thinking like 20 or so. Well, last Tuesday I am sorry to say is the last time we will frequent this establishment. And the reason is this, we have noticed for the last couple of years that the chicken they serve has become very skimpy in size and the guy they have grilling the chicken seems to think that cooking chicken to a burnt char is what is correct. We have put up with this I guess out of love for a favorite place but Being served a emaciated chicken with the wing portions being so charred that all there was to eat off of those pieces was black burned skin on bones, the breast meat over cooked and super dry and the only edible portions the thighs made paying for a whole chicken just plain crazy. We are really sad to call it quits on this establishment as the people who work here know us as regulars. I guess being served chicken served to a black burnt crisp one too many times and seeing the owner who used to cook the food show up only to close the place for the night and collect the days money made us realize that Il Pollaio is Kaput!
author: Steven B.

description:
i can't believe this is the first time i've thought of writing about this place.  i've been going here forever - well, about 17 years...

this is one of those places i don't want to get too famous, since i might have to wait for a table, but they deserve to be famous

for the chicken.  it's the best grilled chicken in the city.

also, the salad (i get the "green and bean"), the great bread, 

and the fries.  the fries are awesome.

one time i brought my dad in - visiting from the east coast.

My Dad: "that was great.  how do you prepare it?"

Old guy who owns the place, now retired:  "a mix of italian spices", or "i'm not telling you shit".  best answer ever

if you like watching soccer, they have a TV.  they were watching soccer during the world series
author: tom p.

description:
Could this place get any better?
NO.

The answer is no. 
Just go and find out for yourself. I can't even tell you how great it is....
author: Francesca F.

description:
Amazingly delicious and fresh roasted chicken. Make sure to ask for the salsa with the chicken,  The greens and beans mixed salad is awesome. The pea soup, minestrone soup are also great. Burgers are huge and tasty...on and on.

The only issue is parking but that's North Beach issue. I am not going to blame them for that. Expect to wait about 20 minutes. Well worth it.

Oh...and the customer service is phenomenal as well. Very nice people.
author: Edward N.

description:
Exactly what I was looking for in a chicken place. Bit pricer than the places back home, but I got a nice sized salad and half chicken for $13 (along with free bread+butter). Wait staff was friendly and fairly attentive even though I was by myself.

The chicken was a standout; ranks among the top I've ever had. It came hot off the grill, with the skin awesomely crisped and the insides juicy. It was sealed up so well that even upon starting my last piece, it released a delicious steam of chicken juice! Needless to say, I finished every nibble on the bone. Eating with hands encouraged.

Overall, Il Pollaio was the best restaurant I've tried this week, since it's unpretentious, authentic, reasonably priced food.
author: Andrew W.

description:
This place closes on sunday. You have been warned. 

I went back after being dissapointed by a weekend closure and the chicken was impressive. A 4 out of 5 on my scale. The skin was crospy and tasty. 

The bread and butter they gave us were cold and unimpressive.

A whole chicken is about $12 and a half chicken is $8.
author: Carlos A.

description:
They have very good chicken, period.

I usually don't like chicken skin, but at Il Pollaio I eat every morsel of their delicious chicken, and the crispy seasoned skin is the best part!
author: Joel S.

description:
Hmm, Argentinian food in Little Italy - great example of why this is a great idea! I've passed this place a million times and never thought to check it out - it just doesn't look like a great place to eat; however, I had the best chicken here and I really can't stop thinking about it. 

I mean, it seems like the best well rounded and reasonably priced takeout in my hood. Between two of us, we ordered a whole chicken, two beers, fries and a large salad. I'm telling you, we rolled out of that joint and had leftovers. Juicy chicken, crisp steak fries and an OK salad. All together $34! If you like perfectly seasoned chicken, you will love this place!
author: Rayna A.

description: BEST CHICKEN. Seriously probably my favorite meal of all time: half chicken, homemade salsa, combo salad.
author: Dominic C.

description:
Really great grilled chicken. Discovered this little gem about 5-6 years ago and haven't stopped coming here since. Service is polite and quick, you get your food pretty quickly, and everything I've tried so far (rib eye, chicken, rabbit) is excellent.

The chicken is tender and moist, with perfectly crisped skin, and perfectly seasoned. I ordered a half chicken with a green salad the other night, and the salad greens are fresh. 

If you want to get the rabbit, you want to get there relatively early, because they were sold out the last two times I went and asked for rabbit.

Highly recommend this place as a cheap eat. Healthy too, if you avoid slathering the bread with pats of butter.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Came here on a cold weeknight and my boyfriend and I were seated immediately. It's a very casual dining experience. Salads are huge and 2 people can definitely share a salad and the yummy fries. My boyfriend ordered the half chicken and devoured it in 5 minutes. So tasty! We had to order another! This is a local place and their food does not disappoint. If you're hungry for some finger lickin' chicken, this is your place!
author: Viki P.

description: Come have dinner here and your palate and wallet won't be disappointed.... The chicken is done perfectly and it is seasoned just right.  It's convenient and fast for take out as well.  Dinner for two or three will not be expensive...
author: Laura C.

description:
Of course, after completely bashing Columbus Ave. eateries, I would walk into a restaurant on the corner of Columbus and Union, and fall in love.

It is a calm Saturday, we have just survived 1 skydiving trip and 2hrs of horrid East Bay traffic. Starving for something simple yet heart-warming, we enter Il Pollaio, a restaurant with large windows, red tables, and completely devoid of neon lights.

Menu item:

Side- Roasted Eggplants
Beautifully roasted eggplants, still retaining the wonderful purple. Sliced and quietly bathed in oil and vinegar, minced garlic, dried herb and red pepper flakes, each bite is tender and flavorful. The taste of vinegar combined with the bite of garlic creates quite a summery note.

Side- Fries
Thick-cut fries in its perfection. Golden crisp on the outside, almost a mash-consistency on the inside.

Char-Broiled Chicken (Whole)
When a piece of chicken is cooked perfectly, it moves one to tears. This is one of the occasions. The outside is grilled charred, yet not overly so, leaving the skin crisp to taste. The meat was so sweet and juicy, you wonder how you could ever eat anything less than this for the rest of your life. And with each bite you can taste the sage and other herbs they've used in the marinate. A drizzle of lemon juice to really brighten up this simple fall harvest feast.

Throwing my hands in the air. North Beach Snootiness: 1. Columbus Ave.: 1.

Recommended for-
when you just want something simple, done perfectly.
author: Fiona S.

description: My good friend bought over the chicken, to-go. Well, I wish I could give it an amazing review, like everyone else. In my opinion, the chicken we got was dry-ish, and needs more spices.
author: Vera W.

description:
Err...  I'm Italian. I don't understand people claiming this is an "Argentinian" place. Did I miss something? There are a number of things that indicate that this place is Italian:

- It's called *Il Pollaio*, not "El..." That is an Italian name.
- There are autographed pictures of Juventus players on the wall (arguably Italy's most famous soccer team)
- There are a number of Italian advertisements hanging by the cashier
- The food is pretty Italian (roasted chicken, pork, sausages, soups, etc.)

Italians have been roasting chickens for centuries. Is there something unique about this place or the food they serve that makes it Argentinian? Please forgive me if I missed something obvious.

Anyway, they have excellent food, especially for take-out. I had a half-chicken with soup and a salad, and I was quite full and very happy for less than $20. The chicken was great, which didn't surprise me. The lentil soup was also excellent (nice, smooth, and rich, and NOT too salt). I enjoyed my dinner, and suspect I will return if I want something tasty and easy on the ol' stomach.
author: Angelo B.

description: For chicken lovers (which my hubbss is), this place is heaven. Amazing chicken and get the grilled eggplant and combination salad. Or get a side of french fries if not so healthy. To top it all, the service here is great. I wish they didn't close so early..
author: Kanwal A.

description:
Chicken fans beware.  This hungry yelper who will be kitchenless for awhile (just started a reno) remembered some fine poultry offerings here.  A quick phone call for a whole rotisserie chicken to go (I prefer to cut it up myself and get the whole bird), 15 minutes later and ta da!  Lovely and juicy chicken with slightly smokey and crispy lemon peppery skin.  The bird does come with some free yummy french bread and butter but do ask nicely.  All for about $12. Feeds a semi hungry family of three.

Five fine clucks.
author: Jen L.

description: The best low cost meal in San Francisco.  Go with grilled chicken and salad combo and you'll be very happy.  I love this place and eat here once a week.  Neighborhood favorite.
author: Niland M.

description:
We have been going to Il Pollaio for years. Jose and Ana always made us feel welcome, especially when we brought our children.
Now their son is running the restaurant. Although the prices have risen, the food is still the same spectacular grilled chicken with salad and sides of fries and grilled vegetables. It tastes like the old country. It feels like home.
author: Susan C.

description: I go here around once a week and just love the place. The chicken is perfectly cooked and seasoned. One time, one of the waitresses witnessed my clumsy attempt at trying to use utensils, knocking a piece of chicken on the floor. They replaced that piece of chicken.
author: Sean C.

description:
Vegetarians beware!! There is little for you here.

I love restaurants that focus on less than 8 dishes on a menu. We don't have a lot of them in San Diego, so I had to come up to San Francisco for it.
My friend and I ordered the chicken, salad, fries, and spicy sausage. Everything was well made and tasted perfectly.
author: Dave R.

description:
hands down the absolutely most perfectly delicious grilled chicken i have ever had in my life. and the grilled onions were the best grilled onions ever, too. i mean grilling in itself is fantastic and the right seasoning on it makes me drool thinking about it. the price for a whole chicken is economically right on for me as well. my bf tried getting the recipe outa the chef with no luck. not only was the skin crispy salty savory, but the chicken itself was JUICY. bf needed some meat so he got a rib eye, cooked exactly right, very flavorful. potatoes that came with it were simple but heavenly.
server was sorta lame. but the other server helped us out once in awhile. salad was crunchy and fresh. minestrone was good, but my bf did add about a cup of parmesan on it :) almond torte was pretty delectable. flakey crust, crumbly inside. we were utterly stuffed and will definitely be heading back!
author: Abigail W.

description: simple food is the best food. stopped here for dinner after a 12 mile hike and oh my goodness...it was amazing. We had salad, steak, chicken, potatoes and french fries. the steak was tender, the chicken was juicy with crispy skin. one of the best parts of the meal had to have been the bread they serve you...along with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. definitely coming back here whenever i'm in north beach!
author: Jen D.

description: My daughter thinks Il Pollaio is 5 stars.  The food is consistently good.  The service is fast and efficient.  The restaurant is small, but clean and in a good location.  The minestrone and lentil soups tastes fresh and home made.  Too often restaurant soups have too much salt, not here.  The chicken is so good, I wonder what the ingredients are in the marinate.  The salads are fresh and simple.  Everything is good here.  The portions are large, sharing is a good idea.  We come here everytime we're in the city.
author: t d.

description: The steak and fires with salad was delicious and the meal was very reasonable, the place is small so for a steak at $20 is a bargain. Next time I'll try the rabbit it sure looks good, and the service was nice.
author: N A.

description:
ahhhh the chicken place.....(as my friends and I like to call it!)

Seriously, El Pollo Loco has nothing on Il Pollaio....Not only is their half a chicken with fries or salad a bargain, it just tastes so fresh and delicious!!!  The staff is so nice, and same with the patrons....im thinking i might go there for lunch today!

Luckily a few months ago, my friend and I sat next to Valentino who will be opening up something on the corner of Green and Columbus...stay tuned for my review on that one.
author: Colette V.

description:
Nice, simple Italian food (but no pasta, FYI).  Brief menu is basically composed of chicken and beef with a few sides and salads, definitely a good place to take indecisive people because the menu is rather brief.  I split with my friend the grilled peppers (want the eggplant but they were out), the small combination salad, and a half a chicken.  

Peppers were good, if a little over cooked to the point of being a touch soggy.  Combo salad was alright (it is 1/3 each green, cole slaw, and bean salad), green bit was fresh but bland, cole slaw was also fresh but a little slim on dressing, bean salad was very good though.

The chicken is, of course, the focal point here.  It was tender and juice with a slightly crispy skin.  The meat was really delicious and very good!

Service was excellent as well, the waitress was nice, quick, and very honest.  The amount of food we go was more than enough and the total came to only about $10 a person!

The main detractors here was the somewhat bland salad(s) and the fact that they seemed to be out of a lot of things.  The eggplant appetizer was no longer available and the flan has apparently 'not been made at all recently.'  If those had been available, this would have been a four star review.
author: Eric M.

description: What can I say! Great chicken! Great Value! My husband and I always get the 1/2 chicken and the house salad for $15.00!  Absolutely delicious grilled chicken; super yummy with the fresh lemon juice! Service is friendly and prompt; love the low key atmosphere!
author: Mary Y.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend yesterday and finally writing a review after plenty of times of coming here! Yay.

Enjoyed yesterday - half chicken & salad $12.95. The chicken wasn't overcooked or anything today and the salad was good!
author: Vivian L.

description:
One of my favorite places  in North Beach. The chicken is consistently great and the sides are really good too.  Love the french fries.  They have great table wine.  The service is good and they recognize their regular customers.  

I definitely recommend the chicken!
author: L. W.

description:
On a beautiful Saturday, my college friend and I got some chicken from Il Pollaio and went to the park across the street for a picnic.

I was skeptical that the chicken could be cooked through completely while still being moist and juicy, but alas my chicken was cooked perfectly and I totally did not care that I was gnawing on the bones like an animal in the the middle of the park. 

My friend really enjoyed his chicken sandwich and said the portion was just too much for him to finish.  I saved half my chicken for dinner later on.

They put the dressing for my salad on the side since we got our food to go, so I can't speak to the over-dressed salads a lot of people have mentioned here.  The people working there were really friendly and I could tell that some people were regulars by their interaction with the waiters.

Great place for delicious chicken for pretty cheap (~$12 for the chicken + salad combo) for a good portion of well-cooked, moist chicken.
author: Naoko M.

description: I must have walked right by this rather unassuming gem a good three or four times during my first day in SF. Little did I know that a dear friend would bring me here later on that evening for my first dinner in town. I spent some time after college traveling around South America, having tried all different kinds of chicken in several different countries, never had I tried Argentinian chicken. I must say, I was more than surprised by how good not only the chicken was, but how good the food was here. It seems like what sets this chicken apart from other South American ones, is that it's grilled and not done in a rotisserie and it makes a huge difference. The chicken is nice and moist, almost wet and picks up a lot of those great flavors that you can only get from an open fire grill. The grilled onions are a perfect accompaniment to the chicken as are the steamed potatoes which are almost dumpling-like. Adela our server, was as sweet as can be and apparently has quite the following here. I will definitely be stopping by here again on my next trip to SF.
author: Luis C.

description:
Went here last Monday with my bf and his dad who are regulars...and by regulars, I mean they go every Monday! So you might want to take my review with that in mind...

Atmosphere: nothing special but clean and allows you to focus on the....

FOOD: amazing! I sampled several items: spicy sausage (not too spicy, really tasty!!), burger (woah...so good), chicken (yum!), split pea soup (good for a chilly night) and the bean salad (if you're feeling healthy...). Oh and we had some wine as well - went well the food!

Service: terrific, but perhaps because we were special customers....

Price: just right! Not too $$ and perfect for a weeknight meal out.

Am sure I will be going back!
author: Jacqueline Z.

description:
I'm the kinda gal that gets peeved at a coffee shop with bad coffee.  A specialized shop should be GREAT at what they do.  Il Pollaio is GREAT with chicken.  

My small family and I ordered a whole order of chicken to go and enjoyed this at home with white rice. Simple, no fuss...just good chicken. This was particularly relaxing after a crazy day out and about in Bay2Breakers.  If you're looking for dinner to calm the night and ease the stomach...this is the way to do it!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Cheap, delicious chicken.  Salad smothered in sooo much dressing.  Beans, coleslaw, and normal salad mixed together as an option as well!  I wanted to sample the sausage platter as well, but the chicken just looked and smelled too good for anyone to pass it up.  It didn't let us down.  

Super simple, well done food.  that what I like to see!
author: William B.

description: The first rule of Il Pollaio is that you're going to eat chicken.  The second rule of Il Pollaio is that you're GOING to eat chicken.  And if this is your first time at Il Pollaio, you HAVE to eat chicken.
author: Michael D.

description:
I can only speak for the chicken sandwich that I had here for lunch one day.  Actually, it speaks for itself and it says, "I am a huge, dry, flavorless chicken breast. Mmmmm."

Bleh is more like it.  I may have gotten a little heartburn eating the darn thing.  There was no saving grace to this meal other than the fact that I was super hungry and scarfed down more than I normally would have eaten.  So, yay on portion sizes, but boo to everything else.
author: Kira K.

description:
After a day out watching whales at the Farallon Islands we wanted something good, fast, and filling.  
We all had chicken and salad and it was delicious.  The chicken was cooked so that the meat was tender and tasty and the skin was crackly crispy.  The server brought out bread first with Olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Then came our salads.  Finally the chicken arrived.  For $11.25, you get half a chicken and a huge salad.  Definitely a lot of good food for the money.
author: Rosemary B.

description: We loved our dinner from here. The server was very friendly and welcoming. The menu is smallish, but what they have is good. The burger was absolutely huge, and served on a roll. Reading these reviews, I guess I have to try the chicken next time...
author: Anthony P.

description: yes, Yes, and YES!!!!   OMG their chicken is great!  Just returned from 5 days of fabulous San Fran dining, and Il Pollaio is what I miss the most.  Chicken, bean salad, marinated eggplant and a Malbec to wash it all down.  A perfect meal, with wonderful service in a fun neighborhood.  I'm trying to replicate the chicken tonight at home.  If it's only half as good, it will be sensational.
author: Kim D.

description: Simple, Cheap and Tasty.  Friendly staff.  Not much more I can say than that.
author: John C.

description: Wow chicken!  Got the 1/2 chicken and salad......GREAT.  was going to order more but the grill closed down for the night while we I was eating (9pm on during the week I believe)
author: Organix F.

description:
Very impressive. The meat is tasty and moist and the skin is crispy and melts in your mouth. I ordered the half chicken with green salad to-go and enjoyed it thoroughly. The salad was prepared with fresh romaine, cucumbers, tomatoes, and radishes. The salad came with a tasty vinaigrette and really good bread (crusty on the outside, soft on the inside).

Best of all?? $10 for all of it! A great deal for a quick, tasty, and healthy lunch. Friendly staff as well. I was impressed with the to go service... Not until I arrived and announced my order did the cook pull the chicken off the grill and put it in the to go box. Awesome!
author: Jill M.

description:
They're not open very late at all.  But, if you happen to walk up at 9:05 and press your nose against the glass -- they might just let you in.

The menu is simple, but there's nothing wrong with that.  There's almost no need for a menu anyway.  Generally speaking, you want the Chicken, some salad, and some fries.  

Why is the Chicken capitalized?  (As opposed to crossing the road?)  Because it is marinated and then grilled.  And therefore, yummy.

By the way,  if you show up with more than 4 people you might be in for a wait - the restaurant is in a tiny space and does get full quickly during dinner time.
author: Stephan W.

description:
Chicken is salty but good
The fries are insanely crispy yum
Best bean salad of my life
author: Christopher L.

description:
Stopped here before the DYL pub crawl for a quick bite (literally, we only had 25 minutes) I wanted something to keep in my stomach for the night since I planned on drinking gross amounts of beer. I ordered the hamburger which isn't the "normal"- (they are known for their chicken), but it was FABULOUS. They put some secret seasoning (okay, maybe its not a secret, but I didn't ask what it was, plus calling it "secret" sounds cooler) that really does MAKE the entire burger. Yum... makes me want one now for lunch. 

I also ordered Sierra Nevada and they brought me a glass with it which was nice (even if I prefer the bottle). The bread they give you before hand is tasty and if you finish your basket, they bring you another one. The french fries were fresh and hot and they give you an abundance of them. My friend ordered the chicken sandwich which was HUGE and looked tasty as well. 

My favorite part of the meal was the fact that they don't put any mayo or mustard on your sandwich (or burger) they ask you if you want it and bring it out separate! Too many places put WAY too much on,  and it is gross. You don't even need any condiments, the seasoning is YUM!

2 meals, 2 beers, ice tea and tip was 37 bucks... not bad!
author: Jessica R.

description: wow!! the chicken is just amazing! True that the place doesn't look much though the food is too good! I'd recommend this place to everyone! staff was very friendly also.
author: Camille A.

description:
This place I think is open all day, which is great because my friend and I came in randomly  for a snack. I'd seen a lot about Il Pollaio on Yelp before, so it was nice to finally come in and finally eat there. 

We ordered half a chicken, a cup of lentil soup, and a salad. Very filling for two people, surprisingly. and that chicken was oh so very delicious. i really love chicken, especially  tender chicken. and boy was it tender. 

i can't seem to remember how much we ended up paying but for a quick snack it was definitely a fair price. 

it's kind of a small place so i anticipate during peak hours it's hard to find a seat. 

i definitely plan on coming again.
author: stacy c.

description:
Simple, but perfect chicken.  The kind of meal that you sit around trying to figure out exactly what they put on the chicken for seasoning.  Could I make this at home?

Maybe, maybe not.  But I will go back to this place again.
author: Steve S.

description:
Someone has been giving me a hard time about this "cold by the door" minus one star comment I previously made. I only stand by it because the restaurant is small and anywhere you sit is near the door. I think they could turn the heater up a couple degrees to help balance this out. 

But, someone else told me they didn't think it was cold at all, so maybe its just my personal preference. 

I liked this place, I just didn't love it.
author: Natalie N.

description:
You're hungry. You don't feel like spending a ton of cash but you want something GOOD. You DON'T want Italian food but you really don't want to travel far from the hood. (Just bc you're in Little Italy doesn't mean you're destined to a diet of pasta noodles.) No worries...go to Il Pollaio. 

Holy smokes I love their chicken! It is so delicius and yummy and so affordable, considering the neighborhood. 

My friend and I were starving one day. We walked into Mario's Bohemian Cigar Store and the prices for their sandwiches were way more than we wanted to spend. Also, they looked like the same regular sandwiches it you could get any where. A moment later, we were across the street, drinking wine, eating chicken, splitting a salad and having the best conversation ever. 

In fact, that's where I think I'll be for dinner tonight :)
Hope to see you there!
author: Dorothea G.

description:
I've walked past this place about a million times. I kept looking at the menu and saying to myself, "I need to go here" and then I'd keep on walking. I don't know why I never stopped in before now, but after fellow Yelpaholic Mimi G. told me "You HAVE to go!" I figured, I'd better go!

  Like someone else said, the place is kind of a dive. The young waiter with bleached, gelled hair and puffy red-rimmed eyes, took my order with a mouthful of food, grunted at other patrons and carried on loud conversations on his cell phone and with his friends in the front of the house. Before I got my food I heard him bark at someone in the back: "We'll serve that! We don't throw anything out!" That's the kinda place this is. Just so you know.

  I ordered the half rabbit and fries. I was told the rabbit takes 25 minutes, so I had a cup of the split pea soup while I waited. I'm pretty sure it came straight from a can, but then again, I didn't really come here to eat soup. Bring on Thumper!

  I have to say it was well worth the wait. Marinated in red pepper and herbs, served with lemon wedges, it was juicy and delicious. The fries were superb; thick-cut steak fries, super-crispy on the outside and nice and fluffy on the inside. Skip the ketchup, salt and parmesan cheese are all I need.

 Served in true Italian style, everything is in courses, just like every other place on the strip. Everything is ala carte. It kinda sucks from my wallet's standpoint, but it is the authentic way to serve Italian food. So for those who complain that it's just meat on a plate, that's right it is. Exactly the way a real Italian would expect it.

  That wasn't exactly the cheapest thing on the menu, but if you are craving rabbit, theirs will do the trick. Next time I'll have to give the chicken a shot.

  Thanks Mimi G.! I owe ya one!
author: Thomas S.

description: Best grilled chicken in San Francisco. The steak and lamb chop are also delicious, as well as the spicy sausages. Be sure to ask for the hot sauce and chimichurri when you go. A great favorite of ours, we go several times a month. No frills, but the little they have on their menu they do quite well.
author: Megan W.

description:
Go here if you want:

-heated chicken on a plate(that's it, just plain chcken and a plate)

-side dish of fries

Not a big deal.  They will also kill a rabbit and heat him/her up too. 
No sauces. Dry meal.  I ate at a similar place in miami with the only difference being in the sauce.  The miami spot had 6 or 7 sauces to complement the chicken corpses.

Bad choice for vegetarians or vegans, unless you want another meal of some lame salad and fries.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Been eating at Il Pollaio for 20 years. Dad, whom ran the place, is now retired, and the son is there to ensure that the quality of food and service lives on.
There's only a few items on the menu, chicken, sausage, lamb, pork and beef-all reasonably priced and deliciously cooked on the grill.
If there's more than one of you, someone get the "steak" fries, while the other order the combo side salad and share. 
If you have a hankering for amazing chicken, save yourself a trip to Zuni, go to Il Pollaio, and still have money left over for dessert and a flick.
author: Mr. S.

description:
Some damn good char-broiled chicken. 
There are many reasons to go to this small, but cozy establishment:
1) tender, fresh chicken
2) hot french fries
3) good, friendly service
4) the hamburger is damn good as well
5) its NOT one of the many tourist traps on Columbus

Note: If the thought of pulling the meat off of the ribcage and other bones of the half/whole chicken makes you sick, don't order the chicken...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Best Fing chicken I've had in a long time. I ordered a ton of food and proceeded to slam down 1/2 a chicken in about...5 minutes flat. Damn that was TASTY! Will certainly be back for more...this is a little hidden gem of North Beach amongst the crazy Italian places.

Oh, and the sides are super-yummy too! Marinated eggplant and roasted peppers...mmm...

Dig on the chicken.
author: Diane S.

description: Love it! Good food, good service, great takeout.  SO GOOD! YUM!
author: Yaqyaq C.

description:
The chicken place.
They have rabbit too.
There's not a lot wrong with this place either.
Sure, old school place that specializes in chicken and rabbit.
author: Kev M.

description: Great change from all the Italian eateries in North Beach. Chicken was good but there wasnt anything special or unique about it. I can probably make better rotisserie chicken at home by adding more spices
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
This is real North Beach. 

Let the tourists go to the fake Italian joint next door. 

Try the Rabbit with the 3 bean salad and it will change your life (for the better). 

Prices are very reasonable (very important in my rating system)
author: forrest l.

description:
I love Italian-Argentinian food and I believe because there is not as much cream/milk that it is WAY healthier than Italian-American food which is normally really heavy.  The chicken is moist, charred, and crispy and before eating here I never knew chicken could be all three! Even the rabbit here is so Yummy! It is also budget friendly in terms of the pricing, but it is NOT fancy - so if you are looking for that move along...

Good Food at Good Prices (especially considering this is in the middle of tourist trap central).

Also it's near the city owned garage near the cop shop.
author: Valerie F.

description:
No nonsense kind of place. Basic menu but everything is absolutely incredible. There are not enough words to describe their chicken. Crispy skin, perfectly spiced, tender tender tender.

Three of us had a couple cold beers, chicken, french fries and salads and it was under 50 bucks.

I wish there was one on our side of town, I'd be there weekly!
author: Melissa J.

description: Had the rabbit special, Yummy! It did taste like chicken, Really!  Also the steamed potatoes are delicious. Very small place not meant for large parties.
author: Cam Y.

description:
We were wanting a semi-healthy meal after a couple weeks of decadence, so we decided to try out this place after having walked by several times in the past and seeing it busy.  If it couldn't take us, we were going to go to Sotto Mare (totally different genre, but oh-so-yummy ).  But , alas, for good or bad they were able to seat us about 10 minutes later.  

The service was friendly, but the food wasn't astounding to us.  Two of us ordered and split a  whole chicken, and I was so sad to find only one thigh (since that's my fave piece), and it hadn't been replaced by anything either.  They did bring one over another thigh when I asked about it, but that's just sort of weird to randomly remove pieces when someone has bought a whole something.  Further, the chicken was overcooked and wasn't as juicy and succulent as we'd hoped based on other reviews here.  My litmus test of sorts is that I want something I eat at a restaurant better than what I can make at home, and this didn't pass the test..  

Oh, also, we had a salad to start, as well as the grilled eggplant, and thought they were both just OK.  

Meh, next time we'll stick with Sotto Mare!
author: Kimberly Q.

description:
Great place for meat lovers!

I'm not a big fan of chicken, but decided to try this place out after my roommate grabbed some take out the other day.

OMG... so good!  The skin (a part which I rarely eat) is so tasty and crispy!  You would think if you're getting that on the outside, there's no way it can still stay juicy and moist on the inside right?  But boy, was I wrong!

On top of this, the place has great service!  The staff is very friendly, and loves to joke.  Our server left the bottle of wine after he poured my glass, and when he came back to pick it up, I decided to joke around and said that he should definitely top me off again before he goes!  He smirks and actually does it.  How cool is that?

My party also had the fries, sausage and the rib eye.  The rib eye was good, but why would you pick anything else besides the chicken?!

Oh, and did I mention the prices? Half a chicken with fries for close to $10!  You can't beat that!
author: Maggie L.

description:
Yes, the chicken was excellent.  I'd say that the chicken actually rivals Zuni's chicken for half the price.  But, I'll say the same thing I said about Zuni: it's still just chicken.  I honestly think that a hot, fully cooked chicken from a supermarket like Albertsons is almost as good.

The fries (fat steak fries) were okay, and the roasted peppers sat in olive oil with some spices and were passable.  

This is a great place for a decently cheap meal when you want some chicken and comfort in North Beach.

P.S. - as far as chicken goes, I wish the Zankou chain in LA would open a spot up here in SF.  Now, *that* is great chicken plus so much more!
author: Brian W.

description:
Glow's

*The chicken was yummy, crispy skin and tender meat
*Quick service
*Relaxed setting 
*Simple and to the point menu
*Two sides, one cup of soup, one whole chicken, bread, two ice teas = $33

Grow's
* If you are looking for more than chicken this isnt the place for you

NB=two people do not need a whole chicken! Maybe if they are big
author: Alexandrea R.

description:
Been coming here for years.  Parking is hit and miss depending on what's happening in the neighborhood.  I usually come by weekday nights for better parking and less of a wait.

I always order the chicken, eggplant, and combination salad.  We always eat family style so that we can try different things.  The steak is good.  Their big steak fries are the best and always hot!  The rabbit and hamburger are both good.  Wine and/or bubbly water tops off the meal!

Service is always friendly and efficient!  Lots of regulars considering location in a tourist area!  Check it out especially if you are a meat eater!!!  Great for families!
author: Ray Y.

description: If you love chicken, you'll enjoy Il Pollaio.  If you are adventurous...try the rabbit!  The food here is solid, but a little on the pricey side (for a simple grilled chicken dish).  I had grilled chicken of some variety.  Not mind blowing, but still tasty and filling.  Didn't make a huge impression on me because I went once, and I haven't been back.  I feel like there are lots of places in the city to get yummy chicken dishes.  So Il Pollaio is definitely doing something right here, but they aren't doing anything that I haven't seen at other restaurants throughout San Francisco.  Ambiance is very relaxed, nothing fancy, and the seating area is kinda crammed.  I may go back in the future if I happen to be in the neighborhood - I'd like to give the chicken sandwich a try.
author: Jenna C.

description: I'm sorry it took me so long to discover them.  The small seating area has made it crowded every time I had tried in the past, but this time I went  around 2pm on a Saturday (still had to wait a little) and I could tell it would be good just from the smells.  The 1/2 grilled chicken could not be any tastier than they do it.  Excellent seasonings.  Fries were pretty good.  With bottle of Perino, $15.  If you can get a seat, try it out when in a chicken mood, or simply get a whole chicken to take home.
author: Marc S.

description: Best take-out or quick eat-in chicken in San Francisco. You're not going for the ambiance. It's a somewhat higher-end version of the chicken grill places you see in NYC, where there's a giant grill in the window with 30 chickens splayed across it in various stages of browning. Il Pollaio also has a giant grill in the middle of place. Which makes it terrible for dates. But great for low-key nights with long-term girlfriends.
author: Matt G.

description:
Hmm, unlike the other reviewers, I found the famous chicken to be not just a little dry, but quite dry and not all that flavorful.  The skin was quite crispy and even chewy.  I would have rated the place and the chicken as slightly above average, but I went with a large group and they raved about their food.  It seems like my dish was the worst.  Theirs certainly looked better.  I should have gotten the rabbit but since this place is known for chicken, I figured that was the dish to get.

The lamb chops looked juicy and they give you a huge plate of them.  Mom said they used the cheaper cut (fattier) but that they were really good, like the ones her mom used to cook.  She also said the accompanying potatoes were great.

Though my chicken was dry, I liked the concept of the place.  Not fancy food, but good, homestyle grilled meat with your choice of salad or fries.  And the portions are generous.  They have a selection of wines to choose from as well.

The server was great, very accommodating.  Seems like you can have a cup of soup instead of the salad or fries if you ask.  It's nice that you can choose from 4 or 5 different side salads too.  

Very helpful tip: most of the tables are for 2 - 4 people, so try not to come with a large group.  If you have more than 6 people in your party, I don't see how you can sit together.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Il Pollaio's chicken possesses such a narcotic quality one friend actually speculated as to whether they "put crack in it." On a block of ever changing Italian bistros, pretty foreign girl greeters crooning for your business, small town hipsters, drunk kids and wandering tourists, this place is the real deal. Order the half chicken, combination salad, half liter of house red (and if you're decidedly famished, the thick cut fries) and watch the passing foot traffic on Columbus Avenue. 

The chops and steaks come in ample portions as well, and while not always the most tender cuts they fill the plate and stomach nicely. Il Pollaio is also a great spot for the solo diner, particularly if you procure one of the coveted window seats where you can sit, dine, and imagine a North Beach of days gone past .. completely and happily devoid of the latest overpriced pasta bistro in the old Columbus and Broadway Burger King location. Have an Irish Coffee or an Anchor after at Specs or Vesuvios and return home or to your hotel knowing you did North Beach right.
author: R M.

description: Oooookay, when you go, ORDER CHICKEN! The rabbit is dry and lean. The ribeye is decent. The salads are great! We smelled chicken a block away, went to a chicken place, and we should have ordered chicken!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
You'll need to go with someone. The portions are huge. You can get the best value ribeye steak in town for $16, plus it comes with a very large salad or fries. The only time I finished everything on my plate by myself was at the end of the North Beach Beer and Oyster festival, after I had already walked into a tree.

I sometimes call in a half chicken and pick it up on the way home.
Don't get me wrong, the salad is nothing special, the fries are good not great, but if it gets cooked with flames, they know what they are doing. Great value and a great alternative to pizza when you need to feed people fast.

Nothing special on the inside, never take a vegetarian here, but they way I see it, it's superior canteen food at canteen prices and that's a sorely under exploited market niche in San Francisco. I can't give any place where they mop the floor while you eat 5 stars, but it's great value for money.
author: Ali N.

description:
This place served probably the best chicken I've ever had. With that in mind...

1. the chicken is grilled with nice seasoning and spices. I don't usually eat the skin, but I made an exception since it contained most of the seasoning. If you must have sauce in your chicken (like buffalo wings), don't bother going there.

2. beware the bell peppers are cold! I'd stick with the potatoes and olive oil, which are very simple and do not steal the taste away from the chicken.

I plan on going back there =).
author: Quarup B.

description: Il Pollaio have one of the best roasted chicken around.  El Pollo Loco is no comparison.  I've never had rabbit and tried it for the first time.  Even that was very delicious n cooked just right n not gamy.   It's a small restaurant so get there early.
author: May Y.

description: Ive eaten here about 50 times! BEST GRILLED CHICKEN HANDS DOWN PERIOD.
author: Nader F.

description:
Really good chicken. Tender--flavorful--juicy. Good value.

I usually order for take-out, as the atmosphere isn't anything special. A whole chicken lasts me for two or three meals. Looking forward to trying the rabbit and some of the sides.
author: Katy D.

description:
I had been wanting to go here forever...and a day.  When I finally went, I was impressed by the quality of the chicken - the seasoning and crispy skin had me sold on this place. 
The fries were delicious too!  

For being in North Beach and being served cold, hard butter with my cold bread, I was disappointed to have to ask for olive oil but they did have it so that was a plus.  Other than that, it was great!  I'll be back.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Not the best on Columbus but certainly really, really good and really, really reasonable.  

The menu is simple and to the point.  I have never come out of this place without being pleasantly full.  The only thing I haven't tried is the rabbit, probably because I just couldn't eat Bugs!

This is a full meal, with all the sides and while it is basic it is so well prepared that it is unique.  

A real neighborhood place, nothing at all fancy but what they saved on the decor they more than make up on quality.

Try this and you won't be disappointed.  Be aware - this is a cash only place, but so reasonable it isn't a burden.
author: Stitch H.

description:
IL Pallaio at 555 Columbus Ave is at the heart of North Beach right off Washington Square. This has one of the best dinner deals in the entire neighborhood. 

The roasted chicken is DELICIOUS! And, for two people with the house salad and a glass of house red wine it was about $15.00 per person. 

The roasted whole chicken is enough to share for two people and the flavor is outstanding. Seasoning is simple, just salt, pepper, some olive oil and a bit of rosemary. Yummy! 

Salad serving for one is also enough for two to share. Simple greens with tomatoes and radishes. Fresh ground pepper is offered. Salad has a selection of dressings, such as blue cheese, Thousand Island, Italian or just plain oil and vinegar. 

House red is a good wine, perfect with the dinner. IL Pollaio has a selection of wines, but the house wine is the most economical if on a budget. 

I have not been in North Beach for a while so this was really a treat. IL Pollaio is a simple down to earth place. Staff is friendly and service is good. 

Place is small and can get busy. But it has sidewalk views, that allows one to take in the North Beach atmosphere and vibe. 

I like to sit next to the windows because it is almost like sitting outside. On a warm evening it can be charming. 

The home fries and sausage is good too. Yet the roasted chicken is the best. This is not a fancy place and there are no fancy upscale amenities. It is really simple and at an affordable price. I think you can get a good meal for an affordable and reasonable price.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Pretty good restaurant.  Food was good and service was quick, no complaints.  I'd go again.  

It probably gets an extra star because its in North Beach (not my favorite area of SF for restaurants).  If im in the area though, and looking for an affordable, delicious dinner, this would be on my short list.
author: Avi W.

description:
Hands down the best restaurant (pound for pound) in north beach.  The chicken is as people say, crispy, flavorful, and a too good to be true $13... for the entire chicken.

The fries are good, but over priced at $5.50.  Over all, the chicken, the price and the I-don't-care-about-image-just-good-food attitude earns Il Pollaio a 5 star.
author: James B.

description: Don't expect this place to be fancy just because it's in North Beach. If you crave roasted chicken, it's a must-try. It's a simple, casual, quaint, and friendly place. Usually packed too.
author: Chihee K.

description:
Eating here took me back to being in Italy! The decor is unpretentious and the food is tasty and affordable. I ordered the half chicken and salad which hit the spot, but I think I would have liked it more if the chicken hadn't been cut up into pieces already. 

My boyfriend ordered steak fries and we could barely get through a small plate of them because the portion was so generous! I am a sucker for good fries and I will certainly order those for myself the next time I'm there.
author: lindsay w.

description: Dont let the cramped quarters and shall i say "interesting" decor fool you, the service here is outstanding and the food is as well. I had the rib-eye and my co-worker had the chicken. both were awesome. I'll definitely be back.
author: Blaine B.

description: Their Pea Soup is UNBELIEVABLE! i've never even sat down and order here, but every Monday and Tuesday they make Pea Soup and get it EVERY MON. and Tues. it's awesome. soooo goood. My roommate is totally stoked on the chicken they cook their too.
author: Danny S.

description:
Best damn breast in SF

 Family run  buz.
sausage sandwich roxoz
love the BBQ sauce
great service, You'll see people that have been eating there for like 50 yrs that live in North Beach
author: INzane Z.

description:
These guys can grill chicken like no one else. Seasoned with just the right amount, not overly done with garlic and rosemary. It is moist, but not underdone, I'm not a fan of pink flesh when it comes to chicken and the skin perfectly crisp. French fries are large cut, crisp on the outside and moist and fluffy on the inside. The mixed green salad with beans are served chilled and the lettuce is crisp and fresh. My husband takes to the lamb and a cold beer. The price is nice. 

Atmosphere and attire: friendly, casual and go in your comfys. We don't hesitate to take a drive from the East Bay and find parking for some delicioso Pollaio. We like to take it to go and chow down under the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Chris O.

description: What u see is what you get here. Great grilled chicken & rabbit. Tried the egg plant..very good. Spicy sausage...very good. Prices reasonable, service good, everyone quite nice and the North Beach ambiance can't be beat.  We're becoming regulars here and for good reason. Grab a window seat, enjoy the food and watch the world go by!
author: john h.

description: Talk about some good chicken! What's even better was that I went with my friend who likes dark meat and this works out for me because I love white meat  -- So no conflict of interest here :)
author: Helen Y.

description: Nice crispy latin flavored chicken in North Beach.
author: Jim J.

description:
Best chicken sandwich in the entire city. Hands down, no question. 

Skip the overpriced, watered down Italian eateries of North Beach and go here instead. You won't regret it.
author: Jeska D.

description:
I fell in love in San Francisco...with a teeny tiny chicken restaurant.
Salad was aight, but the chicken was moist and tender and very flavourful. potatoes were soft and sitting in a nice shallow pond of olive oil - perfect for bread dipping. My wine glass was very full. We had a window seat and overall had a great experience. Can't beat a $25 meal as good as that one was. the wait can be a bit long and the place closes at 9, but its worth it.

Damnation I'm "supposed" to be a vegetarian now...this is one place I will really really miss.
author: Amy K.

description:
I love this place! 

This is the kinda place that should be on everyone's "regular" list.  Not because this place is regular!  Because you should go here on a regular basis.  Though I'm happy that it isn't for most people.  

Anyway, the menu is super-simple.  Just order the chicken, a salad and some fries.  Maybe a bottle of wine and you're good-to-go.  The food will be delicious, the bill will be low and the stomach will be happy.  

Seriously, what else do you want?

Oh yeah, plan to meet some interesting local characters while you eat at one of the closely spaced tables.  Always entertaining!
author: Raymond F.

description:
A restaurant that boasted home-style argentinian grilled yumminess, Il Pollaio means "chicken coop" so guess what their specialty is? We ordered a whole chicken, lampchops, porkchops and grilled onions, AND hot sausages. The portions weren't huge and we wanted to get the full variety of what the restaurant had to offer. 

The chicken tasted very home-y. iono, what could i say? I liked it. I always love chicken. With some pepper and lemon, chicken is always a winner. The sausages were REALLY good too. They were perfect actually. So were the lambchops. Grilled with not a ton of seasoning, it tasted like home. Porkchops were TOUGH AS HELL. BOOOOOO. Don't order them if you ever go. I had to spit out a couple of pieces that just weren't worth to chew through.
author: Angela Q.

description:
I woke up this morning craving chicken from Il Pollaio. My coworker and I used to come here all the time for lunch. We would always order super spicy sausage, whole chicken, fries, and aranciata (my second fave soft drink next to Orangina).  Sometimes I order the grill chicken breast burger without the bread though. I know that sounds weird, but trust me it won't sound weird to the waiter if you make that request. They were the ones that suggested it the first time I had it. 

I usually never order chicken when I eat out because I'm scared that it might come out dry, but not at Il Pollaio. The chicken always comes out  moist and tender, with just the right amount of crisp in the skin. I don't know what they season they're chicken with, but it's damn good.  

I think the staff is pretty friendly (they do look kinda mean sometimes), but at least they're always nice to me when I eat there. The food comes out pretty quickly too.
author: Rennie C.

description:
I like chicken
Its delicious, you can cook it in any number of ways
However
I seldom find an excuse to order it in a restaurant unless it's a part of a dish (think chicken marsala, general tso's chicken, etc).
I went here with a friend who lives nearby, and he ordered a chicken for us to share
A chicken to share? Preposterous! Said I
No chicken can satisfy this east coast appetite
Was a wrong? You betcha!
We got the chicken and a plate of mamas steamed potatoes with olive oil.
The chicken was stupendous, so fresh it was still clucking, soft, tender, melt in your mouth good, the potatoes were soft and buttery and the ice tea tasted like iced tea.
author: Ross G.

description:
The best meal I had when I was in Italy was simple roasted chicken and French fries.  The chicken was to die for and the fries were the best I'd ever had in my life.

Enter my friend and I in North Beach looking for dinner.  We walked by this place and on someone's table I saw fantastic-looking chicken and a huge plate of fries.  Bingo.

We split a whole chicken and a large order of fries.  The chicken was everything I hoped it would be and more, easily some of the best I've ever had.  The white meat was a bit dry, but not very much.  The skin was crispy and delicious.  I only eat chicken skin when it's really good, and this was really good.  The fries, while not bad, weren't the incredible experience I was hoping for.  If chicken is what you want, this is the place.
author: Alex F.

description:
was looking for a place to eat in this neighborhood and my friends and i decided to check this place out mostly because a few of us wanted to eat some rabbit.  the restaurant itself is small but cozy.  
i ordered the chicken and combination salad, since chicken seems to be their thing.  the portion for the salad was very generous.  i couldn't even finish it.  and i actually thought it was pretty good.  the chicken, on the other hand, was a disappointment.  the skin of it was good, but once i got past that, it seemed a bit dry for me.  one of my friends ordered the chicken sandwich and let me say this - that thing was HUGE.  she couldn't even fit it in her mouth!  don't know how it tasted though...
author: Vanessa C.

description:
3.5 Stars.

OK, I've lived in North Beach for about 10 years and go to Il Pollaio about once every 2 years.  The place has good chicken, a good burger served on french bread, and always has good soup.  The food is good.  However, the food is not great.  

Additionally the service is also good.  Not fast, not slow, not overly attentive... very much like the service in Europe or South America.  For example, I waited my entire meal to get my glass of water refilled.  I wasn't frustrated or angry.  Actually I was more entertained by the waitress who seemed to be easily distracted, and at the same time, very good natured.

Bottom line: Good food and good service at a good price.
author: Marc H.

description:
my favorite restaurant in the city. no frills, wonderful staff, great people watching from the window tables and the chicken - simple, tasty, lovely. one of these days i'll try the sandwich that everyone raves about.

i'd give them five stars if they'd stay open later for us folks that dine late.and i wish they serve other veggies besides salad.
author: winelips o.

description:
Why does it say "Latin American" as food-type? Isn't it enough that the name of the restaurant is Italian? 

Whatever. Anyway, I HEART THIS PLACE! 

I especially heart the bean salad with extra dressing, the fries, and the sausage. Mi piacciano salsiccia italiana.

I have family that lives down the street and we've been going here for years. The wait staff is BENISSIMO!
author: Patricia E.

description:
GREAT chicken...some of the best chicken I've ever had. It's cheap and great to go. 

Also, try the marinated eggplant, it's pretty yummy!
author: Rose K.

description: Solid, affordable takeout chicken in North Beach.
author: Zac A.

description: I lived in the area for over 7 years and ate at Il Pollaio once a week.  The food is fresh, delicious and reasonably priced.  You can get a healthy meal here that feels like home cooking and the staff is very friendly.  I recently moved out of the city and one of the things I miss most is Il Pollaio.
author: Gabriella K.

description: Wow. First of all any restaurant that puts the kitchen right out front is making a statement.  We got the pork chops and the rabbit.  This was the first time I have ever had rabbit and it was so delicious.  This is the best place we ate the whole week in San Francisco.  We almost walked right past as there are so many places to eat in the area.  Get the rabbit, don't be afraid. Just do it. The only drawback is the place is pretty small so it will fill up quickly.
author: Jerad D.

description:
I eat here every time I go to SF, usually 4 or 5 times over the course of a few months.

Always consistent, never wavering: perfect grilled chicken with the magical crispy skin.  I dunno how they do it, but it's the same simple perfection every time.

Maybe the best french fries in the City.  Again, always the same, crispy, hot, and screaming for salt and ketchup.

Combo salads are again simple and great.

I see reviewers here complaining about 2 things: food other than the chicken, and the close quarters.  Yes, the place is small.  So what, lose yourself in the food and some conversation.  As for the food other than the chicken, I have no opinion as I've never ordered anything other than the chicken.  My friend once ordered a burger.  Looked amazing and huge.  But why waver when the chicken is so perfect.  Order the chicken, you can't go wrong.

Service is friendly and hands off.

Trust me, there's a reason why a line forms in the evening.
author: Frank M.

description:
This is great, if you like a chicken sandwich, I've never had a better one, anywhere on four continents.  From when I lived in San Francisco years ago to when I fly in for a conference or business, I always go religiously and bring friends.  Great, great, great little place.  No frills, friendly, great chicken, very modest price, this is  a great hole in the wall place.  I've rushed out of conferences at the Moscone center on an hour lunch break just to go and inhale a chicken sandwich here and felt satisfied the whole day for around $10.  Bread, drink, salad, sandwich all for less than $15.
Great place, and I've always been treated well.
This place is the BOMB.
author: Andre G.

description:
Great place, great chicken.  Simple, tasty food, easy location.

Love the service - that one kid who zooms between speaking english, italian, and spanish, and is always really nice but never tooo nice, like he's there to help you but he's there to run the show, too - he is awesome.
author: Keane N.

description:
I've been eating here for years, so I thought I'd add my voice to the many reviews here. My friends and I refer to this place lovingly, as "il polio". Yeah, I know, it's not all that attractive as far as nicknames are concerned.

When I first ate here it was run by Mom & Pop from Argentina. I think that may have been around 1986. My memories are a bit cloudy, but I swear the chicken tasted better then. Nonetheless, it has now been handed down to their kids, and the son does a great job of holding down the fort. They have kept to what they do best, namely chicken on the parilla, or grill. 

The chicken is truly delectable. But I also love the soups here. I swear by the minestrone, split-pea and lentil soups. The soups taste like Grandma made them. They are the perfect hangover cure. They also cook up a perfect skirt stake with chimichurri sauce. I usually get the boiled potatoes over fries, since I am a chip connoisseur, and their chips (fries) are of the frozen variety. Order a glass of Argentine wine, and have a flan for desert. You will not be disappointed.
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
Was heading for a show in north beach and was recommended this place by a friend to meet for dinner. Oh MY! We had

A whole chicken
Lamb Chops
Half a rabbit
Hamburger
Fries
Salad
Minestrone Soup

So it was 6 of us and it only came out to $15 per person including tip! Great place to bring meat lovers or those on a no/low carb diet. Don't get me wrong, the chicken is fabulous... but the lamb chops... oh my,, super yummo and don't forget to order a side of fries (or maybe two :) . Comes out piping hot and thickly cut- brits would call them true chips. Rabbit was a little on the game-ier side, perhaps i'm used to the farmer's market variety- but tasty nonetheless. Skip the headache in trying to figure out which restaurant is the least touristy and head over here for your dinner.
author: Len K.

description: Good, honest, simple food.  The chicken is tasty and crispy and the boiled potatoes are firm, not mushy.
author: David H.

description:
You wouldn't think any restaurant on Columbus is very good after eating at many of them myself and as a North Beach neighbor- usually I like the restaurants off the beaten path. 

Word-of-mouth said I should try their chicken and OOOOOOOHHHHH! SOOO GOOD! Chicken is moist inside, crispy, delicious skin- you keep wanting more. Also try their mixed salad- greens, beans, carrots, all kinds of good stuff. I'm not a huge salad fan but l LOVE this one!

Fair prices, GREAT FOOD, easy location, and staff is always friendly. If there are kids dining there, they always seems to be well-behaved. Also during high tourist season- mostly locals. That's when you know it's good! I get take-out prob once a week!!!

Definitely GO!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: We have been bringing our family here well over 15 years. Everyone has their favorites, chicken, rabbit, combo salad, and they make a great burger and the best fries ever. You may have to wait for a table, but worth it.
author: Lucy V.

description: Their famous chicken was decent. It wasn't as tender or juicy as everyone said it was but the skin was really flavorful and crispy. I expected more from their combination salad but I didn't think it was that special. The fries were huge! The place isn't that big and all tables seem to be for ~4 people so it's not ideal for group parties.
author: Tina T.

description:
I used to live in North Beach and would eat here all the time.  I highly recommend the chicken sandwich & three-bean salad!  

I believe it's family-owned.  And they are soooooooooo nice & friendly!  They always remembered me.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about the food...
author: Jen N.

description:
very disappointing

nice staff and a good local cafe vibe, but the food was very average

dry flavorless chicken, ok big fat chips, bulk standard salad

if you're going to specialise in something like grilled chicken it should burst with flavor, this i wouldn't have served to friends at home

a pity
author: Dan B.

description:
Entrees were tasty, but after sampling other restaurants around town,  the entire Il Pollaio experience paled a bit by comparison. It's not a bad place, by any means. I'll give it three stars. A-OK.  It's just a simple operation where the in-dining option, at least during our off peak visit, bordered on an afterthought. And  maybe my expectations were set too high anyway, after seeing this place on Bourdain's show. 

I'm basically on board with the food raves.  The venerable chicken and sausage were both deelish and prices are reasonable for the area.  I guess my issue, if you can call it that, has to do with certain aspects of the sit down experience.

This is really more of a take out place.  The menu and seating are both quite limited. Soft drinks are served at table in unopened cans. Service was polite but slow, even though the restaurant was almost empty. The condiment for my sausage plate was generic yellow mustard. Very basic sides, like fries and cole slaw, arrive well before your meal, not with it, so entrees seem relatively naked. They dont take American Express.     

Meat's well prepared but this isnt really dining.  We had a flavorful meal, but later in the week had a better experience at Cancun on Mission, with comparable service and atmosphere, and eats just as good, for half the price.
author: Matt S.

description: I love this place. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the city and I've been to a lot of restaurants at this point! I love their simplicity, their freshness, and you get a level of consistency here that cannot be matched. Yesterday I tried their half grilled rabbit for the first time which was great, but we also ordered a whole chicken and a salad. Between the two of us we demolished everything, went dancing, and still ate a slice pizza in the Castro. Yes!
author: M M.

description: I especially enjoy living and eating at this favorite local HOT Spot!  I always order the boiled potatoes and the combination salad is amazing, I should suggest the soups and half chicken, its the BOMB!! You will never be disappointed goiong here. The long and short of it, North Beach is better than just italian food and this is a perfect example!
author: Natalee T.

description: Super tender, juicy, flavorful chicken!! On top of that, they taste fresh and hormone-less, unlike foster farm! We also had the grilled eggplant, it was ok, but that wasn't the focus at II Pollaio. I was told that the Italian sausage is a must try too, next time, next time...
author: Kai Z.

description:
The chicken here is exceptionally good - some of the best I've ever had!  I know they have other things on their menu but being the one-dimensional eater I am, when I find something this good at a restaurant, it's extremely difficult to get me to try anything else.  (And why bother?  Their chicken is that good!)

If you love chicken, you've got to check out Il Pollaio.
author: David B.

description: Best grilled chicken and sausages EVER at surprisingly delightful price! This is a perfect place for carb lovers and carb conscious can dine together happily. Get a whole chicken and share with friends. My low carb husband and I get 1/2 chicken, sausages, and salad. I wish we could eat here more often. As with all other North Beach destinations, free parking requires an insane amount of patience and luck.
author: Su K.

description: Greatest place on Earth! The Chicken and combination salad will change your life. They need a better wine selection, but still 5 stars!
author: Bryan S.

description: We ate at Il Pollaio this evening and enjoyed an absolutely scrumptious meal! Visiting San Fransisco for only 4 nights and craving a chicken dinner, found the restaurant on this site & really glad we did. It's got a "local neighborhood favorite" feeling about it and the food speaks for itself. Two of us shared a whole char-grilled chicken, hot & fresh off the grill served with lemon wedges and with sides of a garden salad and steamed whole potatoes with fresh parsley and olive oil. My husband doesn't like potatoes that much but he ordered a 2nd serve, they were so good. The chicken was crispy skinned and we polished off the whole meal (plus a beer for him & a Chardonnay for me) with gusto! At $53 for the 2 of us including a 15% tip, was one of our cheapest meals in this city and quite possibly the best! Great night :-)
author: Alison H.

description:
