I have been here quite a few times, and the only thing that I've ordered is the chicken. Nicely prepared chicken with great italian spices (in addition to a wedge of lemon) makes for a great meal. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so it is usually easier to take out and bring it home after work. The chicken is occasionally a tad dry, but you have to expect that at every chicken place once and a while.

Price is decent too - $13 for a whole chicken and bread. The sides are ok, but the chicken is definitely the highlight of this restaurant.
author: A C.

description:
We were on vacation in San Fran about a week ago, and i told myself that I have to make time to rate this place...

The chicken - is not good ---- its FANTASTIC!! Very fresh. The potatoes were actual potatoes not frozen crap. (and we had both the fries and the boiled potatoes). We also had their mixed salad which was a mix of all the salads on the menu.

Honestly, the price was very reasonable for San francisco and you also get alot of food. It's seriously finger-licking good. Even writing this review right now is making me salivate. yum. 

If you're ever in the San Fran area - PLEASE go here!!! It will make your stay!!
author: Andreea B.

description: Il pollaio's chicken is excellent as is the food. You get totally stuffed for under $20. However, I would advise anyone to get the food to go. The sit down service royally blows! I went there to sit down and eat on numerous occasions and on every other visit,it took 10 mins just for the server to acknowledge me and it wasn't even busy. The blond Argentinean guy(must be related to the owner)who's the server acts as if there's some place else he'd rather be and begrudgingly serves you when he absolutely has to.  Why don't they just have someone there to wait tables who truly wants to be there and loves what they do?
author: Kolohe C.

description: Boring! Boring! Boring!  Great!  No frills restaurant with professional and attentive service.  The chicken was great, and the price is very reasonable.  Grilled chicken their way is so delicious.  The special, half-chicken and house salad, was only $12.50.  They had healthy portions and was very good.  Simple and efficient, timely and delicious.  No gray area here.  It was simply efficient.  I'll be returning to this joint soon.
author: Tony L.

description: Want a simple meal that is extremely yummy?  Then check out this little hidden gem.  Grilled half a chicken with just the right amount of spices, served with the combo salad that will fill the most veracious eater.  And don't forget to ask for their hot salsa for the chicken.  Their sausages(spicy) and chicken breat are also good picks.  Perfect for a to go meal.
author: Steven S.

description: If the chicken was consistent - delicious sometime and dry as a bone others - it would get another star.  Forget about the sides other than the steamed potatoes and French fries when they are freshly made.  I would also add 2 stars if the staff was the least bit welcoming.  It always feels like you are intruding when you open the door to enter - the proprietor without an ounce of goodwill and his tall sidekick doing what she can to top the boss.  Maybe it's all the tourists beating them down.  But as they say get out of the kitchen if you can't stand the heat.
author: Larry d.

description:
This place is the bomb! =D

Me and my boyfriend come here every 14th of the month to celebrate our anniversary... They pretty much know what we get. The asian couple that sits at the end next to the window. They probably know that we get into arguments too! ha! 

We always order one whole chicken, eggplants (only when they don't run out), and a Pelligrino Aranciata. 

Oh yeah, Bread, Butter, and Sugar! It sounds weird so every time I ask for it they think its for my water but then they realize its for my bread.
 
Good service!
author: Real T.

description: Went here last night.  Wasnt sure what to expect but ended up having a "great" meal. Chicken was awesome , salad was huge and the soup of the day (split pea) was amazing. Almost got hit by a cab but that is another story.
author: Jerry M.

description: If you're feeling like chicken tonight, check out Il Polliano. They have the best grilled chicken and their spicy sausages are delicious. A totally casual spot and way healthier than KFC.
author: Connie C.

description: Simple and to the point, been coming here my entire life. Purest way of cooking chicken, right off the grill, never dry never dull always perfect. Best place to grab a really healthy dinner for 2 under $30. Salads and sausages along with their steak are bonuses. Service is true North Beach natives, cant go wrong.
author: Scott P.

description: This place was alright for me.  The chicken was tasty and I really liked how the sausage was cooked.  I just wasn't impressed by the atmosphere or the service.  If you're looking for no frills and just decent chicken with a clean, crisp flavor, it's worth popping in.
author: Christena T.

description: As a local North Beacher, this is one of only 2 or 3 restaurants that I'll go to on Columbus Street.  To put it simply, it's amazing.  I've been coming here for the past 4 years, at least once every two weeks or so, and I've never been disappointed.  Great service too.
author: Raja B.

description: For all the hype about Il Pollaio, I found it borrrrring! If it hadn't been so overhyped, I may have liked it. I may have also liked it more if they hadn't made us sit with this weird guy. It's a small place, but you shouldn't have to graze hands with strangers to eat your fries.
author: Shannon V.

description: This Argentian joint serves up a small menu showcasing juicy chicken straight from the grill.  Ask for chimi churri (I don't know if I spelled that right) or the red salsa for extra flavor without all the calories.  They're fries are delish.  My favorite side is the large salad--half green, half bean (the cole slaw I can do without) with the red salsa in place of traditional salad dressing.  The waiters are very friendly, so tip well.
author: rachel r.

description: Best Steak in SF. Tender, Juicy, and perfectly seasoned.
author: Roland L.

description: Great seasoned chicken and good prices.  The setting is nice too...
author: Nat O.

description: Some of the best grilled chicken in the city, if not the entire Bay Area. You can get a half or whole chicken to go, or sit down to a no-frills but delicious meal. They're cut down the back and flattened for quick cooking, and the technique crisps the skin without drying out the meat. Spicy house-made sausage and jumbo burgers, along with a trio of basic salads and outstanding fries, make up the rest of the modest menu.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Tasty. Tasty. Tasty. Too lazy to cut the chicken off the bone like me? Order the chicken breast sandwich (which comes with fries or a salad) and problem solved. I suggest ordering it without the bread - it is a lot of food with the bread and much more manageable without it. Also - be sure to ask for the spicy salsa. It is made with roasted tomatoes and is a nice addition to the chicken.
author: CarOline C.

description: This is the spot for some real good grilled chicken!!! The other meats are also real good too!  If the meat seems dry you can get some fresh made salsa to spice it up!!!!! But U might need to know that in order to get that. The salads are fresh...order the mixed salad. THE SOUPs ARE THE BOMB!!
author: Ethan S.

description: This place fills a decided niche: Delicious chicken, good service, generous wine.... yet affordable and casual. It's one of our favorite places to unwind and start an evening out.
author: Lise M.

description: Best chicken ever.  Yummy, crispy skin, moist meat--never fails.  I am allergic to eggplant but I power through for the delicious marinated eggplant--it's good enough to put up with an itchy mouth and throat for 2 hours.  I also love the homemade sausage and the salads...especially the three bean-yum!  Good simple food that all can enjoy.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This local family owned business is a favorite of mine and everyone I bring to this place. While they are not open late, and have limited seating, if you are one of the lucky few to eat here, you will not be disappointed by the service or the phenomenal food. Its always fresh and delicious. Thank you guys, for being a place that I can always depend on to have a great meal!
author: Chris C.

description:
OK, I literally joined Yelp so I could rave about this place. Seriously.

My fiancee and I went to Peru last year and discovered the most amazing chicken we've ever eaten at a smoky little joint called Polleria Toldo. That was last July and we've waxed poetic about it ever since. The chicken was that good.

Then we discovered Il Pollaio, almost by accident when searching for good cheap eats in San Francisco. 4 of us headed down there last night. We ordered two chickens, salad and fries for everyone.

WOW!

There is little atmosphere to speak of and the presentations are as plain and unpretentious as can be. The salad was a simple affair of perfectly fresh greens. The fries were huge, perfect for holding massive quantities of ketchup and dressing.

But the chicken... my God, the chicken!

Succulent... juicy... crispy in all the right places... that perfect, mouthwatering blend of saltiness and seasoning that enhanced the meat's natural flavor to what Emeril Lagasse would call "notches unknown to mankind." All cut into convenient chunks for easy devouring. Chunks of grilled perfection on a plate. No sauces, garnishes, etc. to distract from it. Just... quite possibly the world's best chicken.

The service was prompt and friendly. The owner was charming and engaging, the perfect mix of involvement without being overbearing. Combined with the simple, rustic, delicious food, I can only guess that Gordon Ramsay himself (of "Kitchen Nightmares" fame) would wholeheartedly approve. I know I did.

We received the check before we had a chance to order dessert and the 4 of us split two (huge) slices of almond torte. Having extolled the chicken without the slightest exaggeration, I can say that this almond torte alone makes visiting this restaurant  more than worthwhile. One bite had me reduced to tears of uncontainable bliss.

Then the owner came to pick up the check. We reminded him to add the desserts to the bill and he said "no problem". When we received the credit card slip, we discovered that they were on the house. Wow. We would have been ecstatic without this gesture but that just put us over the top.

I cannot recommend Il Pollaio strongly enough and can't wait to back there again... and again... and again.. and--you get the idea!
author: Anthony H.

description: BANG! Hitting you with a five star review and I am not doing that for just any spot. This place is fantastic. The chicken is so so tender and moist and crispy, words cannot tell how good this is and for 12.75 for a full chicken or  half chicken and fries for 11. I got the combination salad which is great. The steamed potatoes are pretty good. Olive oil and balsamic with good bread before. Go with someone split a large chicken, large combination salad for under 20$ Great place to start a great night! Enjoy yourself. People were ordering the sausage around me but for first time chicken and then expand the menu.
author: peter v.

description:
I took my friend here tonight for his birthday.

We started with the salads which were good.  The Italian dressing is tasty and the portion size is great.

The chicken was good tonight but not great.  The leg was moist, but the rest of the thighs were a bit dry.  The seasonings were good.

The service was a bit slow tonight.  They need to keep a window open because the grill causes your clothes to smell a bit afterwards.

All of this for $31 with tax and tip.  not bad.
author: Brian L.

description: It's true, the chicken was frickin great, but it's called brining and anyone can do it. I enjoyed my experience here, the price was right the food was very good but I have to go three stars because of the super limitted menu. My GF isn't a veggie but close and she couldn't find much to eat here, although she concedes that the roasted pepper side was real tasty.
author: M L.

description: the half chicken that my friend and i were sharing was so good, that we simply abandoned the mixed sausage entree and went ahead and ordered another half chicken. the fries were fluffy, crisp and delicious. i cannot wait to go back for more. adkins dieters, rejoice!
author: Jenny R.

description: My wife and I stopped in here before going to Cobb's to see Sarah Silverman.  We walked the 4 blocks from our parking spot which took 15 minutes to find, braved the San Francisco monsoon, and I can tell you it was well worth it.  The food isn't anything fancy, it's a big plate of meat (I had the chicken, my wife the lamb) seasoned well, possibly with a side. I would definitely tell people to come here if they are in the neighborhood looking for a good inexpensive meal.  Service was good and the atmosphere homey.
author: Jeff R.

description: I have never had chicken so juicy that I didn't need a sauce or whatever to put on it.  This is really something special no wonder it is packed.  I don't know about why the service can be slow though.
author: Stevezee C.

description: If I lived near here, I'd eat here once a week. I'd order dark meat ony, if possible. Our waiter was super duper nice and friendly, and service was fast. I ordered the half chicken with fries, and my friend ordered half chicken with salad. The chicken was hot and juicy...dark meat, that is. I'm not a fan of white meat, so the pieces that were white meat were a bit dry and tough. The skin was SO good. Fries were thick slabs of potatoes. Half chicken and fries (or salad) for $10. Great service, great food. I'll be back.
author: Carol L.

description:
The place is small and extremely hot. Even with the windows open. Possibly due to the fact that the kitchen is in the way fo the restaurant. The tables are close together and the place altogether seems a bit dirty. The service was also pretty down. there is one waitress maning all of the 8 tables there. She frequented the other tables quite often but never came to ours because we were tucked in a hard to reach corner. Then, when we asked her for things, she acted like she didnt want to do them. We had to flag her down after she passed up 3 times and saw our empty plates to ask for our bill. Service is -1. 

The food was alright. The bf got the half chicken which looked really dry and in need of some lemon and hot sauce or something! I went for the chicken sandwich. While my chicken was much better than my bfs, the sandwich was kind of awkward. two huge slices of bread, a big split chicken breast and then lettuce, tomatoes and onions. No sauce and was kind of tasteless. Plus i ate it with only one piece of bread since it was so think. I do give them props though because the vegetables on the sandwich were very fresh which is hard to find at some places. 

Needless to say, we left here vowing to never return.
author: Sarah I.

description:
one of the moistest (usually) chickens you will be eating in the bay, or certainly in sf, so for that it gets a solid 5.  for taste, i would say it gets a 3.  don't get me wrong, it's very moist, and very tender, but sort of lacks on the taste aspect, it's just average in that respect.  but the skin being all nice and crispy and tasty, gets it a 5, so let's leave this as a 4.  the fries are crispy and very good.  the eggplan isn't bad, it's just sitting in oil, but has a good taste, but it's hard to compare as a side to the fries.  also, the bread is quite good.

the service is fast, very fast, and no BS, fast and to the point, exactly what you need.  basically, if you want chicken, come here.  if you don't want chicken, go somewhere else.
author: Jason J.

description: Food is simple and cooked well! I have had this recently for a work luncheon that we do often and it is great for large numbers. The chicken and potatoes are awesome!! muyyyyy rico
author: Gen O.

description: Do you like big hamburgers or chicken?  Then you will love Il Pollaio.  Best french fries in North Beach.  I would recommend getting the Il Pollaio Hamburger and splitting it with someone.  Try to get a window seat so you can people watch.  Best time to go is noon on Saturday or a weekday afternoon.  It's hard to get a seat at night.
author: Buddy R.

description: This is our go-to after work spot both for dining in and take out.  It's one of those places you know will always be consistently good and will hit the spot.  The chicken is great, house wine is good and cheap, and the people who work there are friendly.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great place for a simple mid-week dinner.  You must have the chicken. That's what this place is all about.  It's not a fancy place and you smell a bit of bbq but the service is very friendly and the chicken is super tasty.
author: Manuela P.

description: Their menu is extremely small, but with that menu they do it well.  What can I say?  It's a small joint in North Beach crammed between a few other restaurants and they serve mostly charbroiled chickens.  The chicken is delicious, they have salads and fries as a side and the price is pretty decent.  I've been there a few times and it's always been a good experience.  The service isn't outstanding, but it's not bad by any means.  It's a must try if you're looking for a good lunch or a simple dinner.
author: Anthony T.

description: I've had to downgrade this place.  Last two times, I've had the half chicken and the half rabbit, and they were both too dry.  They still serve the best french fries and minestrone soup of any place - they are amazingly good.  Minestrone is only on Fri and Sat.  Hopefully, they get their meat back on track soon.  Dry chicken is a travesty.
author: Justin S.

description: Simple menu: chicken, other meats, soup, salad, and a few sides. Wines, beer, and soda for drinks. Flawless grilled chicken, the seasoned kind that melts off the bone. Great minestrone. A perfect north beach hang out. Pleasent, bright location with window seats. The son of the owner is a waiter, so service is great. If I worked in north beach I'd go for a salad/soup lunch every day. Five stars because it's tasty, easy, healthy, fast, cheap and nice.
author: Laura B.

description:
Every neighborhood needs a place like this. Good food and honest prices. I only give it 4 stars because, well, its not the top of the pops, but its a good meal. I think the city could use more places like this. We don't need another $20 appetizer that doesn't impress us enough for $20. 

The grilled chicken sprinkled with lemon as if it were fish is delicious. I think its funny that someone else mentioned water service. When eating with gusto here, I need my water re-filled a little more quickly!
author: Maria Y.

description: To start with, there is a mural of chickens fighting on the wall, which is nice. Take note and order the chicken. The half chicken with combo salad cannot be beat. I eat it at least every other week and have never once, in eight years of eating here, been disappointed.  Great bleepin' chicken!
author: John H.

description: Best place for roast chicken in S.F.  All the food is always super fresh and reasonably priced, but the roast chicken is pure perfection.  A really great resturant the locals frequent, the owner and employees are great as well.  The only downside is the small space, you may need to wait for a table at peak times, but it's worth it.
author: PaT F.

description:
This is the place for Chicken...Crispy slightly blackened skin, melts in your mouth, not tough, not spicy, just goodness. If you feel like being a carnivore, get the spicy sausage on the side. Go for the caraffe of wine..Moderate prices. Mixed green salad and fries are okay. Great bargain in the area...Youll be looking forward to your next visit as soon as you leave the place.  Great weeknight place , get there around 7 pm..

Great meal for two with adult beverages in under $20.
author: S S.

description: "COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO" - I gone to chicken heaven! The grilled chicken and steak fries were finger lickin' good! They also serve an excellent seasoned sausage specially made for them across the bay. House salad was nice and crisp, served with garbanzo and red beans. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive even though he and the rest of his co-workers were glued on the tv featuring the futbol game, mexico versus some other team.
author: Eunice M.

description:
Last night my guy and I went here, as we always do, when we are hungry with no food in the house.

The food is always good and the chicken really is super, super crispy hot tastyness. Its a locals spot, a no frills kind of place.

Last night though, the guy who usually is grilling the chicken ended up being our server. He had us taste 3 or 4 of their by the glass wines before having us choose our fav and even poured us more on the house to congratulate our marriage. Hes all "we're not a fancy restaurant but..." and I got the sense that even though they're not, they really care about the experience of their customers.

It might be busy and hot in there sometimes, but the people are really nice, attentive and friendly to customers and each other. A Class act with great chicken.
author: Lady L.

description:
The best. ..just the very best in comfort food. Amazing taste; excellent value. Ocassionally I'll eat in the restaurant, but I love to take it home at least once a week (I like Mondays & Tuesdays for the split pea soup).

The ONLY negative is that it is closed on Sundays (but this family owned restaurant needs a day of rest).
author: Melissa M.

description: This place is completely overrated. Now, the chicken is good, but it's nowhere near to-die-for. I'd gladly eat here again for a simple meal and simple ambiance if I was around that area, but there's so many other choices around there.
author: Dat N.

description: This is our neighbourhood favorite, hands down - a friendly, not too pricey place that knows what they excel at (roasting yummy animals) and sticks to it.  Oh, that more restraunts in the neighbourhood were like this.... Try the rabbit, it's finger lickin'.
author: Taylor S.

description: This is a no-frills type of eatery. The menu is pretty simple, which makes ordering easy ( I hate when you go to a restaurant and they have a ten page menu! And it is a bit frightning when you see burgers one one page and curry on another)  There is a lot to be said for simplicity. Do what you know well and people will always come back for more. The rabbit is unbelievably moist- a rarity because most times that you get it at other places, it tends to be dry. The last time I went, my dining companion and I came right on time to order the last two grilled rabbits. There were some people who got seated right next to us a minute after we ordered and they were so bummed when the waiter told them that they were out, so it kinda sucked when I was like "oh man, this rabbit is delicious!" in my mind, but I couldn't really announce it out loud the way I always do when i eat yummy foods.  At one point, my conscious got to me and I felt obligated to share some of my rabbit with them, cuz I enjoy good karma. And it worked because they were eating some delicious lamb and I got to grub on a bite of that too! Then we started talking to them and having a good laugh about this crazy looking old lady who was sitting behind us with a hairdo straight out of a John Waters film. (Crybaby to be exact). It was awesome. Nothing tops making new friends while eating some good food.
author: Jade L.

description: not a fancy place, but they know how to cook chicken!  which is why i always call it the chicken place... its their specialty!  they have other sides that are good, but seriously people, its all about the chicken.  i have also gotten takeout from here a few times which is great.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
the only thing i didnt like about this place is that they dont emphasis on many sides dishes. they concentrate on one thing and one thing only...cooking chicken. and they do that well! the chicken was nicely marinated and perfectly grilled. its funny because they have only two chicken choices from what i remember: half or whole chicken. haha. but its all reasonably priced. if you do get a side dish, go for the potatoes with olive oil and italian seasonings or something. theyre really good!

the place is small, so if you intend to come here, be prepared for a back up restaurant in case the place is packed.

yum, yum, yum!! cant wait to go back.
author: Melanie F.

description: One of the better choices if you are in North Beach -- no barkers and no pretension.  I especially recommend the half rabbit and fries, but the chicken is pretty good, too.  A little too pricey for every day, the take out service is still the hungry bachelor's best friend.
author: Jackson W.

description: my favorite place for yummy simple food.  the chicken rules, the service is consistent and pretention free and the location in the heart of north beach makes for great people watching~
author: e g.

description:
My husband looooves this place...I don't eat lamb, well...for many reasons, but anyway he loves the lamb here, and you get a whole plate full of lamb chops for a low price, lamb is generally pretty expensive.  I usually get the chicken breast which is soooo tasty, but today I had the 1/2 chicken sooo yummy too.  Really great fresh cut french fries, but I don't eat them, tryin to be healthy ;) Salad there is sooo yummy too loves the chickpeas and kidney beans in it and great house vinegarette dressing on it, we tried the sausages for my 2 year old here today for the first time, she loved them and so did my husband.  Their seasonings are just so darn tasty!! 
I do have to say though, not totally child friendly...not a good place to take little ones...not because they're not friendly to kids, but more so because they don't have a real kids menu and they only have glass cups & not sure if they have highchairs, but I don't think it.  But overall really great place for lunch/dinner, with healthy delicious food!
author: J C.

description: What i like most about il pollaio is that it's low key.  there is no food pimp outside and there is absolutely no pretense inside.  this place is "italian via argentina."  they make an authentic chimichuri that goes on their freshly grilled meats. Food prep is simple and wine (by the bottle or by the carafe) is very reasonably priced for the quality.  my husband ordered the half chicken: small, juicy, and perfectly grilled.  he also got the "fries" which were the best fries we've eatten in years.  they were crisp even down til the very last one (it was a huge plate o'fries).  they offer 3 types of salad and if you can't decide which one you want, you may order a plate of all 3.  i ordered the green salad, it was big for a dinner salad and they let me dress it myself with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar cruets.  i ordered the rabbit (i usually love rabbit) which was not a great choice.  i suppose rabbit is too lean to survive a hot grill treatment, it was a bit dry.  the marinated eggplant appetizer was nicely seasoned and simply prepared.  this place is not fancy, it doesn't hide behind frilly presentation or complicated sauces. it is very straight forward, with a relatively small menu, they've got everything on it almost exactly right.  oh, and the parsley potatoes (they came on the side of my rabbit): delicious, belly filling, comfort food!   this is the type of place that neighborhood folks come (often dining alone) to get a good home-cooked type of meal at a reasonable price served by a very efficient and genuinely NICE staff.
author: passion f.

description: I love this place.  Argentinian-family run, friendly and unpretentious in a pretentious area.  The hamburger is the best kept hamburger deal in the City.  I've tried every meat dish except rabbit and sausage and have never been disappointed.  Has been in the same location for twenty years.
author: Eddie C.

description: First off, this can't be the best steak in SF.  It was good, don't get me wrong, but it was not spectacular.  That said, I really liked this place.  Good food, very generous portion of steak, reasonably priced wine.  I am pretty sure this place was cash only, so heads up.  Very low key place, which I like.  I would definitely go back.
author: John M.

description: Very good grilled chicken, superior grilled rabbit.  Try the combination salad as well.
author: Zack H.

description: I went here last night cuz I heard they have good chicken here and boy were they write. I ordered a half chicken with fries ( wish I got their salad instead) the chicken was huge... When I cut into my thigh piece it was still bloody inside..the lady asked if I wanted it cooked more and I said no so she gave me the chicken for free yay!....hopefully next time it's not bloody again
author: Crum B.

description: Go have some great chicken but do yourself a favor and go early! On our latest visit here we showed up just as they were about to close and the chicken was slightly burnt, dry, and cold. My attempt at explaining the inverse correlation between Chicken bliss and time: This is just a guess but since they have chickens on the fire at all times I'm assuming they overcook by the end of the night, then come off the grill and cool off while waiting to be thrown out, then I walk in and pay to eat them.
author: Hratch P.

description: This place is rad.....my buddy lives in North Beach and took me here and I was impressed.  Chicken is awesome....
author: Richard C.

description: I absolutely love this place, though I haven't been there in ages. Awesome Argentine-Italian family-owned restaurant that has great food, friendly service and great prices. You come here long enough and your server will pretty much know what you want. Maybe at first, the service might be cordial enough while leaving something to be desired, but they are friendly. I typically get the sausage sandwich, fries, and a Peroni, though the chicken is most excellent and never overdone. The rabbit, which I have tried before, is a bit more expensive than the other entrees, but also very good. They have some great hearty salads on the menu as well a great burger. Parking can be a nightmare, but if you're visiting North Beach, I would most certainly recommend a stop. It is also perhaps the best place to people watch and get a view of the North Beach locals, as every customer seems to know each other, and I've talked to many of them over caraffes of red wine. My favorite place in North Beach, and I've eaten at all of them.
author: Miguel G.

description: It is not a very fancy place but it is the food that really shines here. I had Half chicken which was awesome. It was moist and tender. Portions are huge and good value for money. It is truly comfort food at it's best. I wonder why are they closed on Sundays?
author: Purnima S.

description: now this place serves some great chicken, i know, i know its a chicken spot, but come on... wow.  plus, got a whole chicken for a little over $12 and it served 3 people, wine for less than $20 a bottle and some fries to top it off.  if i am in the mood for chicken i know where i am going in the future
author: Tim G.
